hFhCIxagoxIifMT6EToRfQ.text: Not fancy, but good breakfast spot if you're staying close, and if you're not, breakfast served until 1pm. The French toast was delicious. The hashbrowns weren't worth $3.99 for the little side plate. The caprese shrimp salad was decent. Seating was immediate at noon on a Monday. Would come here again for the French toast.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Toast $9.99 and hash browns $3.99
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caprese Shrimp Salad

ROR5lkdKrt1-aP6uwUtd2Q.text: Know what? The food here isn't half bad. I mean lets face it, there are literally over 1,000 places to eat in just a 1-2 mile radius; and they all rank from 1-5 stars. So it's hard to compare all these places on the strip to each other.  So lets say you are staying at the Luxor (Check) You don't feel like walking or waiting in the taxi line to go to another hotel (Check) and you want a decent breakfast but not fast food (Check). Come to Pyramid Cafe! Yes they are going to be overpriced for the meal you get (Duh) that's expected on the strip. But their food is actually pretty decent, which honestly surprised me. I ate here twice. I had the breakfast skillet ($12.99) with a side of pancakes ($8.99 ish) one morning. I can live without the pancakes *Blah* but the skillet was pretty darn good. I would eat it again. The next time I came I had the Country Benedict ($12.99) which was good as well. I would rate the food 4 stars. Service...ummm...although the servers were super nice, they were slow to take the order, and slow to bring the check. Yes both times they were super busy, buuuuuut, they were not on top of their game. I've been to several places that are busy ALL the time and in comparison the speed of the service at Pyramid Cafe wasn't the best. Period. But overall 3 stars for this Cafe. If I stay at the Luxor again I'll definitely will be eating here again.  Note- They only serve breakfast & lunch. They serve breakfast until closing (1pm) and serve lunch from 11am-1pm.  ***Update Coming here twice 6 months later...I have decided this IS a 4 star place. I've never been disappointed with the breakfast! The food IS GOOD! And actually worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Benedict with cheese!  (Biscuit, sausage, &amp; eggs smothered in gravy) Sooooo good!
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Skillet $12.99

UX_CFTrJ6MfvZiOQQI7v2Q.text: What a disappointment to find out that they no longer are open 24 hours.  I wanted some lunch and to my surprise they are now limited on the hours open.  That resorted us into eating at the horrible Public House for lunch after that 5 hour drive to Vegas I was hungry.  So the Luxor has no options food wise for Lunch or Dinner.    This Cafe being closed and the quality of the rooms going down hill at the Luxor has made me not want to come back to stay or eat anymore.

T52FCU2ry_A9_gGrq6ZXzQ.text: Breakfast was great! Good food and value for Vegas, left with a happy tummy! I ordered the California omelette that had avocado, turkey, and Swiss cheese. I only expected a small omelette, but it came with a large omelette, side of hashbrowns and two large slices of toast with a perfectly sized small muffin garnished on the side to satisfy your sweet tooth.

QlmREg_TQcE4bKaZZrRTnA.text: If you're looking for cheap drinks, absolutely come here!!!!!! They were very "heavy handed" with the amount of alcohol they give you in the $5 mimosas and the $10 32 oz daiquiris. We got 2 mimosas, 2 daiquiris, and martini for under $40. My husband and I both got omelets that lacked flavor but I'd absolutely go back for the drinks and service.

Jv7-sOCuoyfqZzx9UDB-wQ.text: We went here Sunday after mass. I had the steak and eggs with hash browns and a blue berry muffin.  Steak was dry and lacked taste. Eggs were just as dry. Hash browns were just okay. Blue berry muffin was falling apart and tasted like a pre-packaged as opposed to fresh as it was very wet.

I7sPW_lBvUWNP-QjqI186Q.text: Had breakfast here, pancakes, eggs and bacon. The food was good, nothing note worthy but it hit the spot and was a decent price for Vegas standards. The environment was nothing snazzy, kind of old school Vegas hotel standard. It's good for what it was mean to do which is serve a simple breakfast and lunch if you didn't want to veer out of the hotel or spend a lot of money.

ijPtcv68QA4d2Bx0hbjYGw.text: Headline: Slow and average....  I'm staying at the Luxor Hotel this week, attending a conference next door at the Mandalay Bay.  So I need breakfast.  The Pyramid Cafe is the Luxors 24x7 restaurant, located on the ground floor ideally situated so you have to walk through the casino to get to it.  At 6am, I expect the restaurant to be quiet.  However, they conspired to make it busy by opening up only the patio.  As a result, there was a 20 minute wait for a table.  There are no "grab a pager and go gamble a little more" - you get to wait in line.  Since it was a patio, the noise of the casino flooded in, making it loud.  You could hold a conversation, but you wouldn't be able to whisper trade secrets (or sweet nothings) here.  The patio has your basic patio furniture for tables around the center and booths around the edges.  No frills - just your basics.  My waitress - Stephanie - was bright and cheery, not pushy, and there when I needed her.  Just what you need at that time in the morning, so five stars for excellent service.  I ordered the coffee, which was tending towards the milder side - no starbucks bitterness here.  This was smooth.    I also ordered the corn beef hash and eggs - the corned beef was described as "home-made"... if by home-made, they mean they got it out of a can, then I agree with them.  However, that isn't my definition of home-made.  The corn-beef hash was that very common type with small pearl-sized potatoes.    The first batch came out cold.  And I mean refrigerator cold.  Not even warm.  So, of course, I sent it back.  I didn't even try the eggs.  Stephanie came back quickly apologetic with a piping hot plate.  The eggs on this plate were also done as I like them, and the hash browns were your typical shredded potatoe variety with nothing to dress them up.  So this was sort of disappointing.  Five star service with One star food, makes it a two-star place in my book.  This is not a place I will be returning to.

AjkhBuWRywC3k4fJMXZ6kg.text: Breakfast all day and awesome service! Great spot to re-fuel and rest up after pounding the pavement in Vegas!

CIH8PU6OA0xAmtQ8y649GQ.text: WhAt DiD YoU CaLL ThAt?  Roaming around... looking for a good place to sit down and enjoy a nice breakfast... my friends, husband and I stopped in here. Walking in seems like an ordinary dine-in restaurant (in a hotel), yet in VEGAS everything is most of the time known to be: outrageous, CrAzY expensive and extremely packed with decor. Well... not here, just waiting in line you notice a lot of different verities of cakes in a Look-See Glass from both ways.  So, as we were seated (waiting around 5-10 minutes at max) GREAT TIMING... I was browsing the menu, which I came upon a unique omelet Ive never seen else were. CHILI CHEESE OMELET for BREAKFAST?!? Yup, as crazy as I may seem (EARLY IN THE MORNING) I choose that as a start off of a GREAT DAY AHEAD OF ME. Honestly, I could have counted to 200 and been notified that my food was ready.  Eating my CHILI CHEESE OMELET... it was FANTASTIC! It was made of egg (your normal egg omelet) which had green peppers inside and full of chili. DELICIOUS!  I highly recommend everyone to stop by and ask for the Chili Cheese Omelet early in the morning.  B+ 4 STARS

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simple yet very modern cake
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Las Vegas cake
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedding cake

J_kHUpMHaNOh02yPLxgB7g.text: Disappointing to say the least.. Waited in a long line fore 20 minutes.. Thank god I got my Starbucks earlier in the morning.. Finally got seated and waited 20 more minutes before the server have us water and asked about drinks. We ordered and no lie..1 hour later.. Good comes. No refills on coffee, juice or waters.  30 minutes later.. Still no server. We needed more napkins so I got up and got some for myself. Did we leave a tip??? Hell no.. Here's your tip.. Serve your guests!! We would have done better at the buffet!

fh82UlXbBK_kJdofVJuwrw.text: Bad, overpriced food.  The breakfast platter is not good. I think the scrambled eggs are made of powdered eggs - they are barely edible. The bacon is greasy, although the hashbrowns and pancakes are OK.  The oatmeal is fine. The greek yogurt berry parfait is surprisingly OK, although the fruit is frozen rather than fresh.  The service is slow. The restaurant itself is clean and simple enough, but I will not be back.

iVKDVn5SZ_ixR-QbSkaU8w.text: Luxor's late night greasy spoon. Well, that is when I frequented this spot as a guest of the Luxor during times I was too lazy (and drunk) to go any place else for late night eats.  It's good for what it is. The servers make sure your drink is full and you get your food within a reasonable time.  I had the burger with the blue cheese on one late night. It was good, yet forgettable.  Another day later, I came here for lunch and had their spaghetti with meatballs. For the price and location, this place serves up some great traditional Americana spaghetti and meatballs. I liked it a lot.

i9flGNOwztNCy7B6EL1rqg.text: This was another place my fiance and I ate simply out of convenience. We had a free stay at Luxor and came here for breakfast just before we went off to something we had planned. It wasn't a premeditated decision - we just wanted a quick bite to eat.   We ordered the Breakfast Combo and Eggs Benedict. Both dishes were mediocre, at best, and reminded us of Denny's which we're also not fans of. I wouldn't come here again, even out of convenience.

r-bq8mkfWrFMBcXaMJbYOg.text: This place is located in the Luxor near the casino area and close to the Oasis pool.   Service: Not the greatest service here. They don't really smile at you or really acknowledge your there. All a sudden they just go "come with me".  Food: Not the greatest food either. It's not disgusting, but it's not anything special either.  Cinnamon Roll with Apples - It was okay, tasted like the ones you can get from the store.  Waffle with fruit - Not that great. It tasted bland and like this made it with water down batter. Meatball sliders - Better than other things I have tried. In my opinion there was too much meat and too little bread. The sauce was good though.  Chicken wings (mild) - Pretty good. It is serviced with ranch dressing which is probably why it tasted good. You can chose from mild, medium, or hot. But overall, I think this was the best thing from the list we ordered.   I wouldn't recommend this place, unless... 1. You are too lazy to to leave Luxor 2. Want something to eat and it's 2am-6am.

r9648Mw1gykv9Bi9cbDkMw.text: This place is OK at best. Would have gotten 3 stars if the food came out faster, servers are friendly and attentive though. If you want a pretty loud restaurant and youre into paying $15 for canned corned beef hash, this is the place to be.

9kT1oqoHi6ajktxUYH4zXQ.text: Went in for breakfast,  got there about 830am and was seated right away.  I noticed the line started forming about 9am. The cafe didn't appear to seat a lot and tables are pretty close together.   I ordered the steak and eggs which comes with 2 eggs, shredded hash browns, toast and a NY strip.  The toast is brought to the table in a basket with everyone's selection.  Food was average.   Ok, if you are staying at the Luxor and don't feel like going far for breakfast.  My eggs were under cooked for my taste. I should have ordered them over medium so my whites would have been cooked more.  My steak was ordered medium rare but it came out medium well.  Flavor of the steak was good and it was tender.  The hash browns, had a crisp topping, but the inside was soggier than what I prefer.  The other dish ordered at my table was the corn beef hash and eggs.  It was a large portion of hash served and he said it was "ok". Food came out hot and fairly quickly.  The coffee server was quick with the coffee refills, otherwise service was slow.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs

bt4OkWTFUBRq77dYbKZ3ag.text: This place Sucks with a Capital S!!!!!! Negative 0 stars for this place!!!!!!! I didn't even get to try the food cuz they close at freaking one in the afternoon. I Mean What The F is up with that!!!!!!! What cafe closes right at lunch time and especially in Vegas????? That's where everything Is supposed to be open 24 hours right? ??? The workers there were so rude and told m e to come back at 5 om and it would be open till midnight so I came back at 10 pm for a late dinner and it was a freaking ghost town!!!!!!!! That stupid rude woman lied to me!!!! Ugh. That's OK though cuz I asked my sister if she ever ate there and she said that she ordered a BUT once and there was a dead roach in there!!!!! Ewwwwww!!!!!!!  This place should be shut down!!!!!! I am going to call the health department and get this sick ghetto place shut way the hell down!!!!!!!!!

CgLMa5sQl-yKmK08YhkTTg.text: We were looking for a place to eat. (we were starving...big time and trying to pass time before the Criss Angel show (i will write a review about the show later...i have a lot to say.)    So we ended up at the Pyramid Cafe.  Located in the Luxor.  It was during happy hour so we did the happy hour menu.  We ended up getting chicken wings (nothing spectacular), steak and vegetable (nothing spectacular) , and some dip.  I can't remember exactly what it was.  I guess it proves to show that this place was... "A-OK."    It did fill me up and I was ready for the show.    Service was so-so.  The waitress was nice but it took a while for the food to come.    It's ok.  I'll probably go there again if I have too.

WFQ_JW-ZePIo2YQBqU0Q9w.text: Excellent service, good food and reasonable prices. Had the all American breakfast, ham steak was ok, eggs, toast and hash brown was really good.

Yb0z-YEybKi4jHmIp13lZQ.text: Do not eat breakfast here or to the buffet. I would even take Starbucks over this place. Terrible greasy food and terrible service. We never saw our waitress and when we did she was very rude. Eat here if you want to waste 2 hours of your wonderful day in Vegas.

1B42Q7ROvjnbMQEre6UkMA.text: I had the Yin and Yang, not disappointing. I really like Eggs Benedict, so this gave me half that and a country style eggs Benedict. Both were good but I think next time we're going with the classic. Eggs were cooked perfectly for everyone. Dante & Pollard were awesome and very attentive. $50, 2 breakfasts, coffee, & 2 Bloody Mary's to chase the hang over. Will be back!!

i25ToWxNiubYOIauLlIG2g.text: After a night of dancing and drinking at Cathouse, we opted to find the closest place for after clubbin' grubbin'. We found the PC.  Because it was so late, there was no wait for a table and we were directed to a large table for our party.   I was craving carbs and protein, so decided to split the steak and eggs. Comes with a side of hash browns. The food was decent. Decent enough to curb my hunger and soak up the alcohol.  Our service was great. Very nice and accommodating.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ORAsz3ZQ2yIbxlVGqwZ0SA.text: The food is mediocre but the price is too expensive  I ordered the egg Benedict and it was average at best The cinnamon French toast was okay but on the too sweet side The American breakfast was comparable to Denny's but at twice the cost  The food is okay but they need to either lower the cost or improve the quality The portion side tho are large

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon French Toast with a side of bacon(extra cost)
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict

-mIbi0p7o0W6lC-6DOqnZg.text: The Pyramid Cafe should be considered an alternative for guests looking for something more than the meager offerings of the food court and Starbucks.  Located on the casino level of the Luxor, the menu offers breakfast, lunch, and dinner fares, for which I'm sure most will find something to their liking.  Although not extensive, the menu does have appetizers, sandwiches, salads, and desserts as well.  On this most recent visit, my cousins and I were looking more for snack versus an actual meal.  Altogether we ordered the classic caesar salad, quesadillas, onion rings, and buffalo hot wings.   All items were satisfactory and our hunger pains soon went the way of all the money I fed into the slot machines........gone and away.  SERVICE:  Quite good actually.  The server that helped us was an older female, but she had a very positive and enthusiastic attitude.  I appreciated the fact that she apologized for the lateness of our food because of a delay in the kitchen.  She also provided drink refills in a timely manner and checked up on us frequently to see how we were doing.  Bottom Line:  As a guest of the Luxor, I would recommend the convenience of the Pyramid Cafe.

zZ_ODmNMky2eFYkKN2pdRg.text: Great place to have breakfast while staying in Luxor. They have a great churro waffle and great service. A 10 minute wait on a Tuesday morning. I gave 4 stars because their steak omelette wasn't the best. Not enough flavor or steak and too many mushrooms.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churro waffle! Yum!

tSpyC30sywaDAPsXbf87eA.text: Absolutely delicious  breakfast. Had the steak and eggs, the steak was something that tasted like it came out of a mid tier steak house. I was very very impressed. The staff was warm and friendly.  However, I guess it did take a touch too long for the food to come out since it wasn't super busy, and their bloody mary was of low quality.  I left with a full heart and a full stomach though.

NYBanz6YCkg_ZtqwM7AFng.text: We were very impressed with the Pyramid Cafe, as were many other people judging by the long lines. I definitely recommend having a reservation. Personally, I loved the cinnamon role french toast but I'll use any excuse to eat dessert for breakfast. Everything on the menu looked devious though and our server was very friendly. Bonus is that it isn't too expensive for strip food. Negatives are the long lines and the fact that they aren't open past lunch time. Honestly, if they were, this place would be packed 24/7.

MLJxfae_iSeV4JDrsRdVUQ.text: My family and I came here for breakfast. I ordered the steak omelett and it wasn't bad at all. My mom ordered the steak and eggs, she said her meal was also good and tasty--aside from them over cooking her steak just a tad.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My family and I went here for breakfast. 6/10.

lkeSJM48qySiaenOZwaIdA.text: Steak was good!  Service was VERY slow.  I mean super slow. Bring cheese in your bag because its 1.25 to add to your eggs.  Maybe I'd order take out -but i wouldnt come back to sit down.

55SkPz_cwe5tYnDnFOw9JQ.text: This place is alright. If you get something scrambled and likely the pancakes(looked good but I didn't order any. Neighbors seemed to like them.)   Service was good and our server was attentive and helpful.   Food was .... sad. I ordered 'The Benedict' and the potatoes are actually deep fried not home fries like I thought. The hollandaise sauce was way too salty and the eggs had no salt at all. The bread wasn't toasted and it was cold.   My mom got the philly omelet which was actually decent but not an omelet more of a scramble. Her toast was just warmed bread, no actual crunch or anything. Again the potatoes are fried.  Our server, Jennifer, was very nice and actually noticed our dislike of the potatoes and swapped it with fruit also offered to let us try the grapefruit juice to see if we liked it before ordering. Overall she made it an endurable experience regardless I will not return.

l-S9tk_000SNZxWTnfKO2w.text: Exactly what they say it is. Simple, good food. Good service. No surprises. Coffee isn't great so grab a Starbucks to bring with.

JmOZ0DcxoLGe1ks4Bc9_bQ.text: The food was cold and tasteless. The sausage was burnt and dry looking like a turd on your plate. The worst breakfast I ever had in Vegas

8wg56vqM7NB4SvdqSrQ31Q.text: It's a cafe and great for a cafe.  They have healthy options for food. The steal cut oatmeal, the plain yogurt, and coffee were very good.  Friendly staff.  Clean. Convenient for us because we stayed in the Luxor.

K6dOlaiICscZFl3WPmtOqg.text: My husband and I go to Vegas once a year. This past year we ventured to new places for breakfast. This visit we stayed at the Luxor and decided to try a new place for breakfast. We saw the Cafe advertised in our hotel room because we stayed at the Luxor and decided to try it. The breakfast was decent, nothing spectacular but it was good and the service was decent as well. Definitely a better deal than the buffet. We will probably go again if we stay at the Luxor.

Tfu5h6yEBRBSBROXjCwbMw.text: The food is ok but the service is hit and miss. That is my number one complaint. We ordered coffee for my wife and I and a glass of milk for my daughter. The coffee came out, no milk. Asked the lady for the milk, she said ok. Five minuets later, and no milk, asked her again. Another round of waiting, no milk. Saw other tables getting served milk for their kids so we knew they had it. This lady just didn't have the time. She even came by the refill my coffee and I again said we had been waiting a while and my daughter would like something to drink. She said ok, walked off. We wound up asking the guy who brought out our food and he was kind enough to go get it.   The service aside we were able to get a decent healthy breakfast at Vegas prices. Cha-ching! Hope you do well at the tables because it isnt really cheap. The place also filled up fast and their was a line waiting at the hostess stand. Speaking of the hostesses, they were awesome and SUPER friendly. I felt bad for them. They had a long line of guests and there were a bunch of tables with dirty dishes on them waiting to be cleaned up. Seemed a bit like management was out of order that weekend.

nkWYJ396QsjVYpAtlBcf-Q.text: This is your typical cafe/diner.  They serve breakfast food, burgers, and other things.  I ordered the skillet, which contained hash browns, cheese, eggs, and bacon.  The food took awhile to come.  They were not too busy, so I do not know why service was slow.  When it finally came, I was a little surprised because the skillet was so tiny.  It was about the size of my fist!  Regardless of its size, the skillet was actually pretty good.  The hash browns were crispy, and the cheese was nicely melted.  The bacon bits were mixed in really well.    A little bit pricey for what I ordered, but all in all, I would recommend this place to people staying at the Luxor.  It is a shame that this place closes right after lunch.

Ujgw_J07KNKWbeZ5yr0-eQ.text: Food was hot and delicious! Simple, but a good coffee shop!  Service is excellent, smiles on the employees and drinks were promptly filled without having to ask!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Current Breakfast Menu as of June 2016
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Vegetarian Omelet

D5NF90W8gq-l7OaC4lPC0g.text: Open air eatery so no real decor. Table and chairs for 4. Food wasn't good at all and the waitress never bothered to check on us. Had enough comps to cover the cost of breakfast so at least we weren't out any money. We won't be back.

siSZq_uyTau6OBYSLzc-jQ.text: Great service. My breakfast was good except my hash browns were mostly cold and barely cooked. The eggs and toast were great and we were seated quickly even tho the restaurant was packed. Very nice waitresses and hostess.

ySoE5cs-SqqNo1ROHyi-7g.text: Good breakfast served quickly, but nothing special and quite pricey - even for Vegas.

mfC70Osd3yOnacaN1RuPAA.text: After driving to Vegas was hungry at 1am so we decided to eat here since open 24 hours. Service was rather slow and people that sat after us was helped before us.  Only after I flagged down a manager and asked did someone come to take our drink orders and then our server came to take our order.  I had the Corned Beef Reuben sandwich which was not that good but I ate it cause I was starving.  Its Vegas and there are PLENTY of other places that have much better Reuben sandwiches.

fTsxTL5wJ4_ImLxr_aWQxQ.text: The only joint to eat 24 hrs at the Luxor. Breakfast chefs are on it. Expect to eat like you are at Dennys and you won't be disappointed.

TgDYWFtFu0YXV93UVkTr9A.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this cafe. I went for breakfast and didn't have any high hopes. Thought it would be another buffet style. This was probably one of the first meals where I actually felt satisfied by the taste and money I was spending. Typical Vegas prices $10-15 meals. We both had omelets and the hash browns were great, so textured. Danny was our server and he was very nice and attentive.

GxjcyWN5sBVZ4E2v_oBvlw.text: Steak n eggs does the trick when not much else is open...especially for only $4 more than pretty much the same meal w/o a steak

sfNjKnHFEP1IzFAhTrTHEQ.text: Honestly I don't know what everyone is complaining about, the breakfast I had here last week with some of my friends was very good and the service friendly.  Sure it wasn't the quicket meal but if you want fast service in Vegas go out of the hotels.   The idea here is to keep you in the cafe while you soak in the sounds of those ever-spinning slots and people cheering/jeering along with it.  This makes you relax and enjoy your meal and that you can afford it.   I had some great blueberry pancakes with sliced bananas and fresh strawberries on top.  Very good.

HvXlXrme_IRI4x_8oJy5Zg.text: This seems to be the place yelpers go to recover after a crazy night of drinking. For me, it was the exact opposite. This was the place we ate prior to a crazy night of drinking. I ordered the fish n chips which were quite soggy and didn't have much flavor. One of my friends ordered a bacon cheeseburger which he did not enjoy that much. I had a bite and it sure as hell tasted better than my fish n chips. Anyways, the wait staff was extremely helpful though and were constantly making sure we had everything we needed. 2stars for the food, 1 star for the prompt service.

5rY-t393ED--ZruMndy5DA.text: We have dined here many times during our stays at both Mandalay Bay & Luxor.  Our go to favorite is the nachos.  Great service each time. Large portions.  Great cheescake.

2dqIuXqEPZYikkJusjhHBA.text: awesome late night food after hours of dancing/clubbing through vegas.

YINyN1xaMHdWoRfVabHIig.text: Won $200 playing Black Jack @ Mandalay Bay...It was 2 am and since drinking a protein shake at 7 pm the only other things consumed were: 5 free Coronas, 2 cigars, and 1 Black Label on the rocks...I think it was time for some food...sadly everything was closed.  Walked into Pyramid Cafe and was seated immediately. Ordered a burger and fries. I made it only half way through my burger and already had to run to the bathroom twice for what the pros call a "reversal". Anyway came back and they accidentally cleared my table. The server quickly brought me some bread to munch on, and took a new order. I got 1.5 orders of food for the price of one, I wasn't kicked out, and the server was very nice to me the entire time and constantly checking on me to make sure I was okay.  The burger was good, the ramen I ordered I felt didn't have enough noodles and had way too much water chestnuts in it...but given how quickly everything came out and the great service...four stars.  ~G

877iak4HOj4-ejeoqES6qw.text: We had breakfast here on Monday and I thought everything was wonderful.  We didn't have to wait to be seated.  As soon as we sat down someone came over and took our drink orders.  The waitress came over shortly after and took our order, she was very pleasant.  Our food came very quickly.  We both got omelets and they were huge!  They came with a big helping of hash browns and 3 pieces of toast each.  We couldn't finish it all.  Everything was delicious.  The only bad thing I can say is the hash browns were a little too salty.  I felt the price was fair for what we received.

qlwWxf7UrzI6NHZDbMT8Og.text: The Pyramid Cafe was our first dining experience in Vegas on our recent trip there. We woke up and wanted a breakfast/lunch style meal without the hassle of a buffet. We made our way through Excalibur and crossed over into Luxor and found Pyramid Cafe. I was put off to see that the sign by the entrance stated it was only open from 6am to 2pm. Vegas ought to have more 24 hr cafe-like operations. I was also unimpressed with the quality of the food compared to the prices. I ordered a prime rib sandwich and my wife ordered a common egg, sausage, hash brown, and toast plate. She was unimpressed with the quality of food also. My sandwich was very very bland. Almost no flavor to it. I needed to add salt and tried numerous other sauces to try to flavor it, but couldn't quite find the right combination. The service was decent. We had Mary Ellen as our waitress and she came high recommended by others on Yelp. Three stars for service, but missed out on 4 or 5 due to poor food quality and over-priced (even for Vegas).

7j0Zg4_j812bB6GfXX_yJA.text: We actually ate here twice, lunch on Sunday and Breakfast on Monday.  Food was ok.  What loses a star is the cost.  It is overpriced for what you get -- I  guess I was thinking that being Vegas it would be more reasonable.  Granted, I was thinking Denny's prices.  The salad was good, but very basic - a lot of lettuce, chicken, lettuce ... you get the picture..  The breakfast was good.   Our server had brought out the preservatives that I wanted (Raspberry) instead of telling me that it wasn't available - so yeah for that!

8vUlwTQeFAKlcZhp0ntsug.text: meh. the turkey avocado sandwich on a ciabata was decent, but not eye-popping and satisfying. it did what it was supposed to do. fill me up. i ate more of the fries, though. the french onion soup is EXTREMELY salty and pretty disappointing. the best part of the soup was the melting swiss cheese. even that wasn't done correctly. it was already cold when it got to our table.   there's nothing great or unique about this cafe. your basic diner food but they charge $14 for an omelette.  i honestly didn't appreciate the prices. even in NY you can find cheaper deals. the portions were good enough. like i mentioned, nothing to really impress anyone. i think i should have gone to little caesar's upstairs in the food court and only spend $2.99 on crazy bread.   the service is okay. she didn't really follow any of our directions on how to split the bill or our orders.

YCIkYUNH4QTpcD7IDMYENA.text: This place is a little pricey considering the food isn't that great and the service can be slow.  Wife said the coffee tasted like motor oil with cream and sugar.   Can't be completely down on it since it's one of the "cheaper" places to eat in the hotel, but it's really no cheaper than ordering room service.    At least with room service you'd get to lay on your butt and wait instead of having to stand there waiting to be seated.

kJ2VkbDLiRhtaaYcAmIzbA.text: The Pyramid Cafe is your typical 24 hour cafe inside the Luxor.  You can find breakfast, lunch, and dinner items throughout the day or night here.  Most of the food is consistent and the service is also good.  IMHO this isn't the best place to grab a bite inside the Luxor, however, if your short on time and can't get in line at the Deli; the cafe is for you.

COC8rqyHfr-EydrdmuOuxQ.text: If I could give this place a 1/2 star I would. SLOW, SLOW, SLOW service. Took 20 mins just to get the waitress to come over and take our drinks. Food was so so, it was incredibly overpriced and very badly decorated. I paid $57 for 5 of us to eat really bad food with really horrible service. The Luxor should post a warning sign before you enter.

PS6ss2yvzzeQrpJiX2tACQ.text: This place is always good for late night / early morning food that hits the spot!  After unsuccessfully searching around Bally's Casino area for a good eatery at 11:00pm, we decided to catch a quick cab to the Pyramid Cafe.  I have visited Pyramid Cafe close to 8 times; it has yet to disappoint.  Sure the waitstaff at midnight are not the most alert, but the food is worth the short wait...and even a long wait if it's crazy busy.  I always get the Magherita Pizza.  It's killer.  ONE time it was odd tasting - I'll chalk that up to a new chef in the kitchen not knowing the secrets of superb pizza.  Okay, maybe "superb pizza" is exaggerating it a bit.  Let's put it this way; after drinking all day long and realizing it is midnight and you haven't had anything to eat, this pizza is the BOMB!  It's even good on a sober stomach as well.  The crust has just the right amount of crunch.  The sauce is light and sweet.  The basil strips sprinkled on top really make the pizza.  And the tomatoes are sliced to perfection - nice and thin.  Seriously, I love this pizza.  I was even awesome as leftovers the next morning. My husband had the steak and eggs.  He's a meat and potatoes kinda guy.  And he was in love with his food while it lasted.  In fact, I got a little jealous.  I was being ignored whilst he was devouring the carnage of the steak and eggs.  Perfectly cooked steak, hashbrowns, and over medium eggs - according to him.  I'll have to take his word on it as I am not a meat and potatoes kinda gal. Go here when it's late and you're hungry.  You'll be full and smiling in no time.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Eggs
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita Pizza

i61MWPqtDxOIajTxfuJVZA.text: I eat here all the time. The food is great sober or drunk. I must've had them all. The Ruben Burger was really big and cooked to my request, medium. The caramelized onions went well with the Burger. I've also had the spaghetti and meatballs. The Bomb!!! The deep fried shrimp was perfect for the price. I remember killing a nice a sirloin steak at the Pyramid when The Tender Steakhouse was closed. I'd rather eat here over Mickey D's, Nathan's, or Little Cesar's Pizza up stairs in the Atrium. Oh, morning breakfast I always have egg whites and toast. Dollar per egg does the job right.

82ImKOAvcaznj1pRVdiD3g.text: Had breakfast here 2 days in a row by default.  I had no choice.  Well I had mroe of a liquid breakfast.  Bloody Mary (smallest glass ever!) made with their signature Luxor Bloody Mix not very lovely.  I poured half a bottle of Tabasco in it with a couple squeezes of lemon and a pinch of salt and pepper to give it some taste and the server (crazy old lady) got offeneded that I didn't praise the damn drink.  I told her that it was weak and she said, "It's because it is made so well."  I just wanted to be like, "Sweetheart I used to be a bartender in San Francisco and have experienced more Bloody Mary's from different establishments than the number of years you have lived time 3."  But I figrued she would just have asked me to leave.  So then, I ordered a Margarita.  Not lovely but of course I drank it.

qRflbiN28X3i8wadu5EsnA.text: I don't know what it is, is it the fact they serve some ridiculously good hashbrowns?  Could it be the service totally sucks but I don't care because its 24 hours and the prices are decent?  It could be, but for some reason I've remained a fan of the Pyramid Cafe through good times and bad.  Given the nature of many of Las Vegas' residents and visitors, more places should have more late night hours.  With a 24/7 joint like the Pyramid Cafe, the diner food becomes a reality but in a pyramid-themed corner of the Luxor.  Beware:  Their sandwiches are overpriced and so are the waitresses ... meaning they're being paid too much by the Luxor to deliver crap service.

rlaVPgNY23is328l5Z0mIA.text: Because I stayed in Luxor, I ate here because of convenience.  I ate here 3 out of the 4 days.  For the most part, the sandwiches, soups, and salad was pretty good.  It's cafe food yanno?  However, the last day, the  drink server poured too much water in my teapot and when i barely moved it, it swished around and splashed on my leg!  It was so hot that i almost dropped the entire teapot of hot water on my leg but i managed to put it down.    I was hungover and tired and trying to eat something before I catch my flight out so I didn't complain, I just wanted an icebag so I don't blister.  Now here's the bad service part....i had to ask another waitress to find our waitress, our waitress had to call the manager, the manager had to call security.  When he finally came, i said i just needed a bag of ice.  I should've just took it up with the drink server, told her that she filled up the pot to the absolute brim, and had her get me a bag of ice from the kitchen.  oh well.

zVZhP6A6AXvjwXn6Xt-_8w.text: Was here for lunch one day waiting for another family member and service was pretty bad. We ourselves came late, coming from another hotel to meet some people that were staying here.   When we arrived the waitress was giving us attitude about how it wasn't her section; like the sections could be clearly seen. When we ordered our food, we also needed some boxes because a couple had to leave. The boxes took so long that they finished their food before the boxes arrived.   The sausages were overly salty, eggs and hash browns had no flavor. And even the coffee tasted kind of watery.

JA-5tYOAtPFGE59IQajfnA.text: We had a 25 dollar coupon we had to use at the Luxor, so before we drove back to LA on Sunday we had brunch at this cafe. The food was about what you'd expect at a place like this and it was perfectly edible, but the prices were outrageous... I know it's Vegas, and I adjust my views accordingly.   It also had poor service. This wasn't our extremely harried waiter's fault -- he apparently had 16 tables to cover in the morning rush. This shouldn't have been a surprise onslaught. After checkout time, of course there's going to be a rush. But they had far too few waiters, and they had a long line form at the hostess table despite having a third of the restaurant empty.  Skip this place. Either just get a bagel at starbucks on your way out or stop somewhere on the road. Unless you're in our situation with a coupon, there's really no reason to go here.

Kd3XOzFdMtfXx18r6hFV8w.text: Nothing to really rave about. Very simple no frills food and slightly overpriced.  I ordered a Black Forest Ham sandwich. When it was served, my first thought was "This is it?" It wasn't very big, but tasted alright. The dried tomato in it was a nice touch. It's served with a choice of cole slaw, baked potato or fries. I had it with the fries which weren't oily. So that's a good thing.   I looked at what my friend's wife ordered and wished I ordered what she had which was the salmon. Again, it didn't look like much. Just a piece of fish on yellow rice. It did look like a good slice of fish. I can't remember what my friend ordered.   They also serve breakfast all day. I thought about ordering that, but since I was leaving the next day, I had planned on taking in a breakfast buffet in the morning.   Service wasn't very friendly. The lady who took our order had a pretty much "Whaddya want" type attitude. The intonation in her voice when she check on us made me afraid to ask for a refill on my drink.   Really nothing special except being with the company I was with. I hadn't seen him in years and it was good catching up on life with him.

s4mJ_ewkfDWIZrwb7rxiEA.text: Terrible service, I don't know if they're understaffed or they just don't care. A lot of open tables with long wait

tuvV8mVJT1p4s2TLnwHQ0A.text: Good food. Convenient if you're staying at the Luxor like we were. Everyone was happy with their food. I got the smoked salmon potato pancakes. Yum. Perfect hangover breakfast.   The only thing is the restaurant is right next to all the loud ass slot machines so if you are hung over as we were, ask for a table in the back.. which we did not!

smMuzwieyiLCfOoWw4pf5w.text: Great breakfast.  Love their omelets and standard breakfast fare.  Oatmeal brulee was wonderful.  Our favorite remains the cinnamon roll French toast.  Lines get long around 9 a.m.  Our service was great both times this trip.

Rc87gSISSYtepoV9KkY23w.text: Breakfasts were creative and pretty good. Lots of different choices for pancakes and french toast. we had the Peanut Butter stuffed French toast, the Orange Creamsicle, the cinnamon roll and my personal favorite, the Strawberry Shortcake. All pretty good. Relatively inexpensive. Make sure you ask for the turkey sausage to be cooked well done..not sure why you'd have to ask, but ours came out pink one day.

D39esECD7Hk6HM3Nfr920g.text: A crazy night out so far and everyone is all liquored up. It's time to end the night, but not before a nice hot bowl of PHO.   But wait, we are in the middle of the Vegas strip and there's no PHO restaurants nearby  - none that I'm aware of at least. So what do you settle for?   I almost felt like I hit the jackpot when I saw RAMEN on this Cafe's menu. Even though in the back of my head I'm thinking "What the hell is ramen doing on the menu?" And there I was willing to try it anyway.  As expected, it turned out to be a big big mistake. What was I thinking ordering Ramen at a cafe. I've had better instant ramen from 7-11. Ramen was topped off with chicken breast, some green onions and carrots. CARROTS! yes CARROTS - It's totally wrong!. Broth tasted like it came from a Campbell can.   I'm giving it 2 stars because I only sampled the ramen. The SF-Club sandwich was (shrugs shoulder) so-so. Waiters look overworked. Service is veeeeeery slow. It almost seemed like they're getting paid to work slow-motion. You need to flag someone down to get a coffee refill.

UguJoOpMb_Nudc4x6yETDA.text: Good Cafe inside the Luxor. Shared a Reuben Sandwich with fries and a cup of clam chowder.  We finished it all if that says anything more.  There's a discount coupon in your welcome package if you're staying in the hotel.

OuH0rMi4eYdZsT1cmY78TQ.text: I ate here twice while in Las Vegas for a conference. Service was fine both times.  Ambiance is not great, but it is a simple cafe next to the casino floor.  Prices were reasonable.  Reuben sandwich was tasty.  Western omelette was fine.  Predictable food at an OK price...

ummzipw7OrB9WZuhWXn3OQ.text: The food was GREAT! the staff was GREAT!... and i had the BEST balsamic vinaigrette I've ever had... I had the personal pizza too, but it was too big to finish. I'll definitely come back again!

JXOq3Xmqgzsgiq52A0Pjlw.text: We have eaten here dozens of times during our Las Vegas stays. We are sad it is no longer open 24 hours. It's been a long tradition of eating here, and we are happy to see that when we do get a chance to eat here, the food has been fairly consistent. I love to get the chicken tenders and fries, and my husband loves the club sandwich. We also enjoy the breakfasts here. This last time I had a steak omelet, and altho the steak looked like steak-flavored lunch meat, with some A-1 sauce on it it was very tasty. The prices are on a par with what you pay anywhere else in Vegas we feel. If the service was just a bit faster I'd give out five stars. But it's still a nice place to sit and people watch.

xuolrZ4NdolKqUTEJ3Jruw.text: Average food and service. We had breakfast here since we stayed at Luxor. Would I go back here? Maybe...I wasn't impressed. The cakes looked really good though...

6df_jehnD7CZl83wJca7iw.text: All I had were their nachos, and they were the BEST. Huge portion too! My ex and I loved em! Gotta get back here. Sure you'll wanna eat somewhere else...but if you're drunk and hungry and at the Luxor, get these Chicken Nachos!

Zu-h82Oyz4FMjvPrHGrDXA.text: This is the third time I've eaten at a 24 hour cafe in a Strip property in the last two weeks. This time, we ate here after going to the Barenaked Ladies concert at the Mandalay Bay Beach. Initially, we were going to do the Red White & Blue in Mandalay Bay, but I almost passed out at the prices and lack of veggie options. Having visited Pyramid Cafe once before when I first moved to Las Vegas, we decided to make the trek to the Luxor. Scanning the menu I was bombarded with options for vegetarians, from breakfast to entrees to apps, I had a lot of choices and wouldn't have to ask for a lot of substitutions. I ordered the nachos (holy crap it was a huge plate filled to the brim with beans, pico de gallo, cheese, sour cream and guacamole), everyone else at the table had breakfast, and we shared onion rings. There would have been no way I could have finished the nachos. What I liked best about them is that the PC uses real cheese. I've had fake cheese on nachos plenty of times at other cafes, but there was at least two types of shredded cheese used to make this plate.  After having mediocre experiences at other cafe's, I will definitely hit this one up again...

EFwZEGGouSme5MXdpG16QA.text: $12 chicken strips don't cure a hang over.  $12 for generic chicken strips, service was slow, so gets 3 stars!

R8v7mejOgLkZ2Yosz2Qt4g.text: I say I am done with this place every year but this time I mean it.   1. They have the worlds oldest staff, I am cool with this as long as they can still do their job, Jill cannot.  2. We order something that shouldn't be very hot, she drops the plate off and you wouldn't expect this plate to give you a burn bad enough for a blister, no warning and my son was burned.  3. I had to ask another waitress for items, she was great I handed her a tip also.  4. Food isn't all that great, this place just works at 2am for food...   I dunno, I have been coming here for years, I just don't feel it anymore.

6ebxZ8f4fwjwyR2-hT0OtQ.text: Since the Excalibur decided that having a cafe for breakfast was not a good idea we ventured into the Luxor and came across the Pyramid Cafe. Unfortunately they close after lunch time so they are not a 24 hour operation which is most unfortunate because the food they offer would be perfect for late night eats. No matter I guess at least they offered early morning breakfast. I forget the name of the dish I ordered but it was a basic breakfast of eggs, sausage, hashbrowns, and toast. The eggs and sausage were good but the hasbrowns and toast left something to be desired. I liked the decor of the place. The Luxor does a phenomenal job of staying True to their theme. The prices are typical Vegas, which is you pay more than you usually would for something, so I have different price expectations for them. My breakfast was around $9 and for Vegas that is pretty typical so it does not bother me. I expect t spend more money to dine out on vacation then I would at home especially at restaurants in Vegas casinos. There are cheaper dining options on the strip like a Dennys or Cocos so if I did not like these prices I could go elsewhere so I don't feel like I have the right to complain too much about that. The food here was nothing special but it was not disgusting either. Our waitress MaryEllen was a sweetheart and she had great customer service. She made sure we had everything we needed at all times. I ordered a milk and she forgot to bring it out to me and when I reminded her she was very apologetic and made up for it. To her defense the place was packed and she was working alot of tables. The food took a little long to come out but it was very busy that morning.  Overall the place is just basic. Nothing remarkable. I plan to stay at the Luxor on another trip to Vegas and when I do I would say I will eat here again I just think I will choose another selection for my meal.

bXgbn_qFHNkge5APPQGl_g.text: Yummy breakfast! My wife and I loved it.  I had pancakes and eggs with sausage and my wife had yummy chicken and waffles.   The waitresses were so friendly and nice. Cute older ladies. And they kept our cups full of juice and coffee.  Over all it was a wonderful, cozy, warm restaurant for breakfast or lunch.

8aDrf6mHlj901RtbrB86vA.text: It's ok. Decent food. Nothing amazing. Service was pretty good though.   I came her for lunch and was starving after my flight. In spite of my hunger, I found the food to be just ok. Not bad at all but nothing to write home about either.

YqGALF290EbT6JhGLfqOGw.text: My scrambled eggs were watery and not cooked all the way. My waffle was too thin and too crispy if that's even a bad thing for some . I would cut through the waffle and it would fall apart in many pieces not allowing me to get a good bite. It ended up looking like mashed potatoes. As for the flavor it wasn't as sweet as I like and seemed abit salty. Didn't get any flavor of an actual waffle. On the other hand my boyfriend had an egg white omelet that came with potatoes that were really good. Nice seasoning/ flavor from his dish.

1SuhGgcLgpLh7uIUl0R9nA.text: Outstanding breakfast.  I kept it simple today with the bacon, eggs and toast. The portions were nice and Stephanie was an excellent server.  Great start to the morning.

LFC8LSnTAD7mEJtW5lw-lw.text: We had breakfast there. Basic breakfast, good service, overall good meal.

UioSn265OJagiuvPyztkcw.text: Country fried steak was an explosion of flavor in my mouth, country scramble was the perfect amount of eggs sausage vs gravy even the potatoes were pretty dam good.. perfect hangover good  I'm feeling better already

pF6jYsqofcogaoOKaU3nFw.text: Conveniently located in The Luxor where I was staying. Situated near the poker machines (no escaping them wherever you are in the casino) and seemed like a decent breakfast option that wasn't a buffet.  Service was lovely and I was quickly seated and my order taken. I went with The Benedict (two fresh poached eggs & canadian bacon served on an english muffin with hollandaise sauce & hash browns) and a Fresh Brewed Iced Tea. The benedict was lovely and nicely poached flowing yellow egg yolks. I noticed that American egg yolks are much more yellow than the traditional Australian orange egg yolks. It had a delicious flavour to the dish and even got a bonus mini orange muffin too. The tea was unsweetened so you can add as much sugar to it as you like.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iG1qZejDq0NIGYahOHfmsQ.text: I need to preface this by saying that the only thing we ordered here were free Bloody Marys that we earned through the MyVEGAS app. However, as we were sitting waiting for them, the waitstaff was AWESOME and super friendly, especially considering we were getting something for free. Really nice people, and they were quick. In fact, we were staying at the MGM Grand, and decided on spot that the next time we'd stay at the Luxor, just because the service was so good. We also read the menu while we waited and decided on the spot we'd be back because everything looked very good. The restaurant was very clean and open, and even though there were many people there, it was quiet and intimate. Cool decor. Can't wait to go back and eat there! (And the Bloody Marys were divine!)

mzcl6r9XeUDFncttYxeegQ.text: Food was definitely not worth the price, presentation was good but flavors were off. I had the sunrise wrap and my husband had the French toast, he said the toast was doughy. My wrap on the other hand had so much cilantro, it tasted like soap and even though I asked for no potatoes it  tasted like they doubled the amount of potatoes. Would not return.

PFW_ol6yAItN2USN2d5fEQ.text: Would leave 0 stars if i could. Have been waiting for over 25 minutes for someone to take our order. Poor service.

h2aseVboK5XGsWrE9IUCRA.text: Ridiculously understaffed, they had our server Deborah waiting all the tables in the room and it took her over 25 minutes for her to come to our table to take our order. I'm willing to pay $16.00 for a breakfast burrito but I shouldn't have to wait that long to order a simple burrito.  Then waited 35 minutes to bring the food, total of 60 minutes to get a breakfast burrito for $16, not to mention the $5 orange juice. Won't be coming back.

PPOyDYIk2MLxMGj-_klogg.text: What a disappointment! Have had lots of trouble finding restaurants who will honor gluten-free cooking since we got to town 2 days ago. To that end, I googled gf restaurants and Pyramid Cafe was listed predominantly as a place to go. They had not one thing listed on the menu. When I asked our waitress, she offered they had gf bread but nothing else. Really? Not only was our food really lame and tasteless, the coffee was cold and part of my husband's order was forgotten. If you don't have gf options and aren't in any way willing to accommodate such dietary restrictions, dont advertise that you are GF.  It irritates people! We certainly will bypass this restaurant in the future.

-d9WBCo7UoNz6_IDWfuHlQ.text: I ordered the hash and eggs and it was good though a little bit salty for my taste. The serving is very generous and came in layers; two eggs on top, corned beef hash in the middle, and hash brown at the bottom.  As for the coffee, it tasted too watered down.

mx_tI-rzM_V9oRasbRilYQ.text: This place is located right inside Luxor Casino in Las Vegas. We came here on a Saturday morning for breakfast and the line aws pretty long. They have two lines, one for regular customer and other is for VIP. But it was moving pretty fast since the restaurant itself is decent size.   I thought the food was okay not beyond my expectation. The price is okay not overpriced nor cheap either but what do you expect something inside a casino? not cheap right. Overall the bill for 4 people breakfast/brunch was around 60 dollars. I wouldn't recommend getting coffee there as Starbucks was literally down the hall way (probably like 10 steps to get there).

u5cqD45lfMoIGzpWUrsyXw.text: We ate sandwiches: chicken Caesar and San Fran club. Unlike the Caesar we had at Citizens, the chicken was moist and the bread had Parmesan cheese grilled onto it. The San Fran club is a turkey and ham sandwich with bacon. Lots of meat, so worth the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YzQ6QyULfyIhuMyMi2LGww.text: Love this place...breakfast is delicious and lots of options. They are so fast and awesome service...Victor was the best...we have been here 2 times already and are coming back before we leave the Luxor...

LtbF8Sq4S1cts3TqfmJNIA.text: Took a while to get seated but once we were, the service was decent. There were some moments I wished they were a bit more attentive (ex. My sister ordered more tea but was waiting on hot water longer than necessary). The food was pretty typical diner food. I got a California omelette with wheat toast and home fries. It was tastier than I expected. The home fries were the shoe string kind and were nice and crispy. The omelette was cooked well and cheese was nice and melty. Toast was good with the orange marmalade.   If you're staying in the luxor, it's a good option for breakfast if you have an hour to kill.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California omlette

R0dzLyScaGIODNRcZG2mFA.text: I've always avoided eating at the Luxor  because their restaurant lineup never appealed to me. But, decided to give their cafe a shot with a friend after checking out their menu. They offer plenty of standard breakfast and lunch fare, but the standout dishes reside in their diverse selection of French toast. They don't just add different toppings to the same bread. They utilize different types to create the best profile.  Despite the lack of carrots in the carrot cake French toast, the bread was soaked through with custard and topped with garnishes that added a nice variety of tastes and textures to make it a standout dish. Likewise, the strawberry shortcake French toast was an enticing array of flavors highlighted by the strawberry compote. Lighter, overall, than the carrot cake, it was equally as good.  Less successful were red velvet pancakes that had a tough, almost rubbery texture and icing that was thick and grainy. However, the hints of caramel were a nice touch. Their monte cristo was a solid rendition with an exterior providing plenty of crunch. It could have benefited from more ham, but the flavors were still decent.  With a menu full of items that are more likely to satisfy than impress, it's the specialty items like the French toast that should be ordered for a memorable meal.  4 Stars

AFR1VEw-KynA1YieOzvi6A.text: Not the breakfast I was looking for. For an overpriced breakfast, our food came out of the kitchen piecemeal and that several different temperatures, none of which were hot. The coffee was good but we had to keep waiting for a cup to be refilled. I had the pancakes and they were quite lackluster and flavorless. My eggs were good, but the toast was cold and unbuttered.  If you are looking for a good breakfast before you head out of the hotel, the better choice is to go to the deli. Much better food, much quicker service.

Lp5VIpNQewRNWEMG_8eJeQ.text: I ate here with my wife to stock up on food before entering the Cathouse to open Spring Break with a bang at the Welcome to Fabulous Yelp Vegas party.  Big mistake, because the chicken treats never stopped coming once we were inside Cathouse!  But at least our leisurely dinner was very enjoyable when we ate it.  French Onion Soup was rather weird looking with crispy onion straws strewn all over the soup's Swiss Cheese top.  But it all melted nicely and tasted hot, cheesy, very oniony, and satisfying as this comfort food should.  Red Skin-on Potato Salad was nice and cold, with pretty hard but tasty potato chunks, egg, celery, and green onions.  Creamy Cole Slaw with carrot slivers was very good, except not as cold as I would have preferred.    A very good and big Monte Cristo sandwich was the highlight of my meal.  I got both powdered sugar and Strawberry Sauce refills to keep the sandwich of hot ham, smoked turkey, and melted cheese sweet and well lubricated.  The divine sauce even contained ripe half strawberries in it.  Diane enjoyed her Fish & Chips, and caused me to chuckle as she began to dip her fries in the extra powdered sugar supplied on request.  Service was excellent and attentive, and included several unrequested Iced Tea refills.  This was a definite 4-1/2 star experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monte Cristo and Potato Salad, with Strawberry Sauce on the Side
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips and Cole Slaw Side View
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Overhead View of Fish &amp; Chips

reUxUVQ4fg9-YFdq0F7gQA.text: Considering this restaurant is on the floor of a vegas casino, it is not too bad and not too pricey. I had a San Francisco Club, BLT with turkey and ham. Sandwich was good and fries were excellent, hot and crispy. My wife had the reuben, which was really good with plenty of corned beef (ratio with sauerkraut is very important). Sandwiches were 15 each. Coffee was drinkable, nothing special. Better coffee would have made this a 4-star review.

ROcrmRr_5wpcDA4u7RMVxw.text: First time here. We found the place a good place for a quick meal. Place is well staffed with plenty of seats. We were there on Sunday at mid morning and although busy, there was not more than a few minutes wait.   Service was excellent from everyone. Orders taken quickly, coffee and waters kept filled, and all our orders came out together and in a timely manner.   Menu selection was excellent, breakfast is served all day. Prices are reasonable for a strip location. We all liked our food.   We would return.

wVawzoSEBlncFQelP2Ux1w.text: Have the food came and the other half came later ?  Who brings frys 30 minutes before the burger ?   Who forgets your drink ?  I think the staff is half asleep / drunk

PRFV4dr0h5X0UroMyQekGA.text: My boyfriend and I visited the Pyramid Cafe on Thursday, June 25, 2017 for breakfast.  For our meal, we enjoyed the eggs benedict, French toast, and a combination platter.  Our waitress, Cheryl, was incredible!  She was attentive but not overbearing, and she made very playful and lighthearted conversation with us throughout our visit.  Before leaving, she asked us all about our tattoos and the stories behind them.  She was extremely friendly and I just wanted to say how much of an amazing job she did!

SBSdohnkYOjttKlhwEZaJA.text: I always feel like places like this will be disapointing with entrees that sound good but dont deliver for the price or compared to surrounding restaurants, i did not get dispointed here. This place is pretty kick ass for a hotel restaurant. Had steak, nachos, ortega burger, and a few different sides. All of them were way better than expected and it's open 24 hours although they have a limited menu for late night.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Santa Fe burger w/ onion rings

SX6SdoO1va0N6qtq5axE9g.text: We got $35 worth of comp so we took ourselves to Pyramid Cafe for lunch on our last day at the Luxor.  The wait was a bit long, the hosts didn't seem to have it together.  We were seated in the back and had a great waitress.  We split the nachos to start.  The order was way too large to finish.  They do put cold chopped tomatoes on top though with makes the nachos cold as a whole. My boyfriend got the burger, so large he didn't even touch his fries. I got the Monte Cristo sandwich.  OMG. Soo good with that sprinkle of powdered sugar and strawberry preserves to dip in.  Got it with potato salad instead of fries. p.s. I should have gotten the fries instead.

XzvSF_3AjmIb6XUbuXrhRg.text: We stayed at the Luxor for almost a week, and only ate here our last night! It was about 2 o'clock in the morning and there was a mix of people getting a late meal after checking in to the hotel and a few clubbers coming from LAX & Cathouse. Then there was us - my BF wanted to pull an all nighter and thought that getting something to eat would refuel us (and the 2 Monster energy drinks he bought earlier) - but it just wasn't going to happen!   I ordered the 3 Egg Denver Omelet and my BF ordered the following: their bacon, eggs, and rice (he wanted asian style sticky rice, but they only serve a rice pilaf); short stack, a side order of toast, and an extra side of bacon. I don't know who would want to stay up after eating all that!   The food was good and that 3 egg omelet was too much - 2 eggs would've been good! My BF really enjoyed his meal(s), but I don't think he ate all of it...   Service was slow - but our food came out in a timely manner, just waiting for our waitress to come around to take our order took about 10 minutes. The bathroom is separate from the restaurant - but the walk wasn't too far.   If I had to choose between Pyramid Cafe and any of the late night eateries in the Luxor (McDonald's, Nathan's) - I would go to Pyramid Cafe, but if other places were open - I would go there first!

oigm0HtoOlP_AAIlVrG4Iw.text: The Pyramid Cafe is located in the Luxor on the outside of the casino area. We stopped our first day to grab some lunch. They had a pretty good selection of sandwiches to choose from. The Reuben was very big and delicious. I couldn't even finish the entire sandwich because they filled it with so much meat and sauerkraut. Most of the rest of my party had burgers and thought they were good as well.   We also stopped here the day before we left for a breakfast since everyone was sick of Mcdonalds. I got the All-American with bacon, hash browns, and toast. The eggs were cooked great as were the hash browns and toast but the bacon was so incredibly  overdone that I couldn't even try them. Again they had a good selection of breakfast options to choose from. Two of the other people I dined with got the pancakes and french toast which they enjoyed.   Service is really slow and it seems like the waiters forget about you after awhile. To me that would be the one thing that could improved greatly. Other then that this is a great spot for breakfast and lunch.

qg6KONb7VLEGdJObbEzocQ.text: Located in the main floor of the Luxor Hotel is this cafe, which is an American Diner Themed place. There is usually a short wait line to be seated when I was here. The service response time was a bit slow one time I was visiting, but this is offset by the fact that this cafe is a far better choice than going to the Luxor Buffet.   As the wait times for the buffet can be substantially longer, I'm choosing to eat at the cafe out of convenience. The food is slightly better given that I can chose to have a Fresh Veggie Scramble Omelet, or fresh eggs prepared how I like them.   Considering the convenience of getting breakfast reasonably quick, for a crew to work at a tradeshow convention (or any outing), consider eating here first before eating at the buffet.

kZ9l8kymMv4VEaz8evPZlQ.text: This place has horrible costumer service.  I'm not sure how the food taste.  After sitting there for 15 minutes with no waitress (I even flagged one down and she told me to wait).  Needless to say I walked out.  Lastly, the menu is pretty expensive (breakfast and a drink).  You might as well do the MORE buffet.

0bE-a8f036pD4FZHyoKQZQ.text: This place is almost like Dennys, but it is seats way more people. I had the All-American Breakfast with ham and portion sizes are incredible. The ham is HUGE, too large to my liking as it was too dry. The fried potatoes were a little burnt. I had my eggs scrambled, okay but nothing special.   I would have given Pyramid Cafe 2 stars for the food, but the service was quite exceptional so I gave them 3 stars.

Qyh3wx5K-vC2L9Z25G5G4Q.text: It was a choice between Pyramid Cafe and Backstage Deli.  Since the deli had a line, we went with the Cafe.  It wasn't super crowded and my group wasn't really going to eat too much considering we planned on buffet-ing later in the day.  I wanted to get a small sandwich or something but the average entree price was over $12 with the exception of the soup and salad was $9.  The soup was good but the salad I got was miniscule.  I also got a half pound of dressing to go with my miniscule salad so that was quite comical.  Thank goodness my friend at the table used up the ranch with his fries.    If I had to choose again, I would've went with the deli as I didn't need to pay them a tip.  The night of the Rock and Roll Marathon, the line to get in there was HUGE since it was probably the only place that still was serving food past 10pm!  Not many options to choose from here since LV Blvd was still closed off past 11pm.  Not likely I'll be back here unless it was super way late in the middle of the night.

QSbxdQOf303ncpg1-ijQ7g.text: Pyramid Cafe is open 24-hours, so that's aways a plus...when it comes to a HUGE strawberry daiquiri (you get to keep the cup), golden lightly salted fries and piping hot pepperoni pizza cravings at midnight.  Which this was an option in DC to put an end to Denny's and IHOP. Blah!

lBwWu8XMUnQD0k1rtREalw.text: Portions were large, servers tried their best to provide good, fast service despite seeming understaffed.  The place is rather busy, probably b/c those who are staying at the Luxor are more isolated from the strip and dont have many choices for a quick bite to eat.  I did, however, enjoy the nachos (2x) and the SF club sandwich.  If you are staying at the Luxor, use the $10 off coupon. :)

1W2BZqC3-My3fFeX2CFoow.text: Have always enjoyed this cafe at Luxor..great food and prices! Only open for breakfast and lunch...for breakfast I had the "Ying Yang'..Eggs Benedict/Country Benedict,comes with hashbrowns..EXCELLANT..great service too  by Dante...

uyE9MKV66FocRrcGhSfbEw.text: Good omelette and friendly staff.  Right in the Luxor so very convenient    Open breakfast and lunch.   Good variety of selections

p8uuVLrriboWWfcSaBxNpQ.text: The food was good, but the service SUX.  We went with a 5.00 off a 40.00 check.  The bill came to 38.00, so I said " lets take a piece of cake to go, since its basically free with the coupon.  I asked for one kind of cake, I ended up with a totally different kind.  It took about 20 min to get the cake.  Ridiculous.  The food was decent though, my partner and I shared a salad( overpriced at 7,00) and a chicken pot pie( huge and a decent deal at 12.99).  The pie was loaded with chunks of white chicken in a creamy sauce.  Pastry was good.  The corn muffin it came with was so freaking dry.  I asked for some bread instead.  My partners dad had a club and it was large with plenty of fries.  He enjoyed that.    Oh, I wanted to take something "to go" from here.  I called while I was in my room and was told I'd have to wait on line to be seated and then order from a waitress and then I could take it to go.  Whats the point in that?

c6esINVYXtRcaLyraV5rAQ.text: Definitely a cute Cafe. It's in the middle of the Luxor, so once you find it, not a bad deal. The prices are reasonable, but the food was sort of hit or miss.   We had the French onion soup, which was very tasty and not too salty. Nice broth, soft, flavorful onions, and just the right amount of gooey Swiss cheese.   The pizza was average. We got  pepperoni and it was quite greasy. I can deal with it as I love any pizza, but I have to admit, probably not the best I've had by a long shot.  The service was wonderful, as they were attentive, kind and ready to explain the menu.   If you want a quick bite while staying at the Luxor, this may be a serviceable option.

UAQXHo7rtOp-4b63YRmgCg.text: Waited for about 15-20 minutes to be seated.  This seems like a short wait in Vegas for breakfast at 11am so we were psyched.  Unfortunately we waited longer to be acknowledged at the table.  Don't seat me if I'm going to be ignored.  Especially when I'm eating breakfast at 11am, clearly I was out late the night before.  Our server was not at all caring about us needing anything, the only person there who was at all efficient was the woman pouring water/coffee and clearing tables.  Our server made no eye contact with us as she walked by fifteen times and then finally came over and couldn't wait to leave.  She had no positive customer service skills.  She did get our order correct though so that was a plus.  Also, the food was good but very greasy. I had a breakfast skillet with avocado instead of meat.

0QlvnDxdAIKtSu8OTVI4pw.text: The food here is delicious and very reasonable!! I had a sausage egg and cheese bagel. They serve breakfast all day which is awesome. The service is great as well. We came here two times and loved it!

rlUdj67dNGs1ht3KJhyTyg.text: I would not recommend.  The food wasn't as appetizing as it looked on the menu.  Service was awful.   We haven't seen our waiter since we ordered.  Certainly not worth the price.  It's a place that MGM resorts can hike the price because it's in a casino on the strip, but they have little concern for the quality of the food or service.

QNypo4ViFsTG2ynkD4RdPw.text: Traveled from Houston, Texas....we was staying at the Luxor and was looking for somewhere to eat breakfast.  We walked around the casino and found this restaurant...the location was not bad, it's hard to miss. The line was pretty long but the wait went fast. The hostess was nice and seated people quickly, personally is my favorite type of hostess because it reminded me of myself back in the gap lol.   I ordered the Churro Waffle. One word AMAZING!!! The cinnamon sugar goodness just melts in your mouth with the whipped cream on top. It was too good! I really enjoyed it along with the stripes of bacon!   I tried a piece of my mom's buttermilk pancakes! That was also amazing, nice, thick and fluffy. The service was quick however we had to keep reminding the server to bring a bottle a water, but one of the other servers retrieved the water without even charging! GREAT!!  Would recommend this place! Food was too flavorful, can't beat that!

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churro Waffle

uzbmiPWiJq7I5vSUkdamQQ.text: Waited 15 mins in line outside the cafe and then another 25 mins after being seated before even having a waitress come by our table. I asked three times after waiting 15 mins to see if our server went on break or something. I must be wearing an invisible suit. Cheryl is definitely lost as a server.

Fm3-0U0frIdEtz3N23dWaA.text: If you're trying to redeem a myVEGAS comp mimosa or Bloody Mary drink reward, make sure mLife give you a slip or voucher. They will not accept your mLife card.   After my breakfast, I had to walk back and stand in the mLife line for another 30 minutes to get the slip. The supervisor at mLife said Pyramid cafe should've called mLife desk instead of having me walked over and waited in line.   When I handed the slip to the Pyramid cafe supervisor and told what mLife said, she said they still needed the slip. Either I have to get it or mLife rep walk over with the slip. Both mLife and Pyramid Cafe had very poor customer service.   Not only that, when I was dining in the cafe, I wasn't even finished with my corned beef hash and the server just grabbed my plate. She didn't even ask me if I was done eating. I thought that was very rude. I didn't say anything at the time because I was disappointed in their corned beef hash anyways. It was dry. Tasted like the canned ones. I thought it would've been different with real corned beef but it wasn't.   Will not return.

m5SMuG72wFKnlIQdEptMpQ.text: WAFFLE IRONED GRILLED CHEESE! Sooooo good. My husband got the 3 avocado toast and loved it. But that grilled cheese was so delicious. The tomato soup was so tasty. Would definitely order this again. Service was fast and friendly. This is a nice spot for a quick bite and nice atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GOwYwV03zK82cTOod0AhOg.text: Cant Believe I Have Never Written A Review For This Place!! I Love Coming Here,Everytime Im In Vegas I Eat Here At Least Once For Breakfast! The Staff Is So Amazing!! The Food Comes Hot And Fresh And You Get Great Portions For The Price! You Can Also Give Them Your M Life Card To Earn Tier Credits For Every Dollar You Spend, Thank You For An Awesome Experience Everytime!

UHfWreTtZGHCBIiYNFJ_eA.text: Worst breakfast ever, hashbrown is oily, steak is chewy. Won't come back again. The staff is nice.

m2niEJ4MkNm0W5vktpU3cg.text: Nice little cafe with barely any wait. Its kind of hidden behind a curved wall, but no line is fine with me. Price was a little costly but which hotel restaurant usually isn't? So i guess it's average compared to many.  Ambiance: It's a simple cafe style place. Nothing fancy.  Service: This is meh. Some try so hard to put on a smile but you can so tell they don't want to be there at all. They look tired, bored and want to go home. They still try though.  Food: Not too bad. I mean, you can't really mess up on American breakfast as its quite easy to make. But they have lots of varieties and some items you can mix it up if you cant decide on one. Love that!! The table next to us got salmon lox with guacamole on the side and all. Will definitely go back. Especially when there is barely any line.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancake, bacon, toast with boiled eggs
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak, eggs and hash brown
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mix and match Benedict (perfect for the ones who cant decide)

KxQiDqagjxvvd1IeTwwkWw.text: The pyramid cafe is so good. The quality of all the food is top notch.   Chicken and waffles is so good with the frangelico syrup.  The chicken was cooked perfect.

LE0dPZj5eYcC3LOsoOlK5Q.text: Terrible food with all the negative characteristics that suggests. We saw Pyramid Cafe had 2.5 stars but ultimately decided to give it the benefit of the doubt and try the breakfast because we were too lazy to walk anywhere else outside of Luxor. We ordered an omelet, the pyramid burger and eggs benedict. The "hollandaise" sauce they give you for the eggs benedict literally tastes like a bunch of butter mixed into something that I wouldn't even call a sauce, it was a runny yellow water as opposed to the creamy warm yellow most places offer and I ultimately steered clear of the sauce and asked for something else. I also found a piece of men's short hair in my food (we're all girls so it sure wasn't ours) and the manager was kind enough to remove the food from our bill. I got the pyramid burger because I was thinking well, it's a burger... and you can't really mess up a burger, but somehow they still did. There's no sauce whatsoever in the burger, the patty was burnt and dry. The omelet was huge, mostly egg. I mean I know omelets are made of eggs, but for $20 I would expect more veggies and a thin layer of egg all around. On a positive note, the service was great. Our cups were never empty and everyone was kind, but unfortunately we came here for the food. I know our next Vegas trip won't consist of pyramid cafe.

-7rhq9Zkj85e5YIavGV4cA.text: Cute place! Very basic breakfast dishes for reasonable prices. The food was okay- the waffles my friend ordered were much more tasty than what I ordered!   Even though the cafe was extremely busy, our server was very attentive and kept coming by to ensure we were enjoying our meal and well taken care of. So great service!

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NTVaH-d6T9tHk1wJb03VZg.text: Ridiculous high prices for a run of the mill casino cafe. No reason what so ever to charge $4 coffee $5 OJ, $16 for a simple eggs and bacon. Save yourself money and eat at the buffet. More choices and it's the same dam food.

aBiv7VejwrhQ0CHxqFO4QA.text: I'm very disappointed loved this spot but the last 2 visits have been really upsetting menu has changed and food hasn't been as good as before..not to mention my toast had mold on it yes MOLD was grossed out the whole day !!! Not happy at all!!! But gotta say manager was very nice thank you

0FZqLghbG2NvGT89ZAstWw.text: Service here was awful.  I ended up going to get my own water multiple times.   Breakfast burrito was good, but opened it up and almost nooooo chorizo.     The waiter told me i was supposed to order extra chorizo and new chef to blame .   Bulllllll!    Terrible!

GQC3HuHPZXqJ4YQPI0atfg.text: Returned and the cheesy potatoes are AMAZING! Service good- coffee still meh. Will return.

0_spSRSA9GnDBty1Df06tA.text: Easy meal. Never a wait. Not a crazy big menu but there is something for everyone. Service is hit or miss.

NJrLnclqfRV0hrlzICx7vQ.text: Came here for breakfast since I was staying at Luxor while on a work trip. Ordered the veggie omelette. Service was quick and food was awesome! Would recommend this place to future Luxor guests!

7gKkxc6K6mAPWqdhiChRXg.text: This restaurant offers overpriced and tasteless diner food that you can enjoy in a cloud of cigarette smoke from the casino floor that is twenty feet away.
