Trust me, it's definitely worth a trek outside of the hotel to find something else. We ordered the eggs benedict and corned beef and potatoes and I immediately got a stomach ache. Thanks, Pyramid!

MA-RpGl7rBFSRK9Da3yPCA.text: Can't go wrong with a New York Steak and Eggs meal... Especially when it's free!   My family came in just before the rush so we were seated and served within 20 minutes.   One thing I've noticed is that they've remodeled this place and that they only serve breakfast and lunch no more dinner.  I remember that they used to be open 24 hours but was probably over a decade ago.   The service was great and so was the food!   The menu is simple and reasonably priced considering its on the strip. It's not like Downtown though, where you can find excellent deals for cheap...   We stayed at the Delano next door but made our way to the Luxor and we were glad we did. There are more dining options at Luxor and are more value priced compared to Delano or Mandalay Bay.   I'll surely be back again if in Vegas and on this side of the Strip.   Thanks for the excellent service and great tasting food!

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Steak and Eggs with hash browns and toast ... Mmmmmm
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamer
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Line after 930am

kfAKxeS6L234jftWxpVuGw.text: Came in for breakfast.. We were at right away and Loraine was our server. She was very attentive and constantly checked in on us.   Looking through the menu, there was nothing that stood out. Especially for the cost so I asked if I could get something off the lunch menu which I was allowed to.  I ended up getting the club sandwich which was awesome. The food came out quickly and was perfect temp. It was all very good.  I would give this place a 3.5 if I could. But decided for a 4. The main reason was nothing was able and beyond but very good.  The breakfast was lackluster but the lunch was great. But basted off the price...you may be better off going to the buffet near by.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FJ7_ndBT4_-5ldTH5DatDQ.text: Ever stay at the Luxor? Well, sometimes it's hard to find decent food close by. I recommend Pyramid for breakfast, their portions are huge, the prices are kind of expensive, and it's not that good. Decent, yes, and definitely try the oatmeal. Service sucks, waitresses are grouchy although one of the waiters was very sweet.  The food is okay. Just feels like I'm eating at Denny's and paying twice as much. I'd never come here for dinner. They open pretty late though.

FMZWqGSTd8S08shtB5ZHBQ.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this unassuming cafe inside Luxor.  I met up with a friend who was in town and staying at the hotel.  We weren't sure where to grab a bite, but didn't want to wander aimlessly.  How about here?  Ok.  The menu at Pyramid Cafe is your standard cafe fare.  Burger, omelette, fries basically a Denny's under a different name.  However, once I got my omelette, I must say it was much better than expected.  Still just an omelette but not a greasy mess that you might find at any other mid-rate resort hotel on or off the strip.  Prices are reasonable.  Not too loud and basically a good spot to rendezvous to start the day if you or a friend is staying at Luxor.

tC_DykV0JatDHxwaFROA-A.text: It hit the spot at 3am after a night of clubbing. Service was sort of slow but I would go back.

LLOYKk-vf3V-F6OSSlGyXQ.text: My husband and I were so buffeted out when we wandered in here, that probably anything would have tasted good. We ordered burgers, me with red wine caramelized onions and bleu cheese and him some sort of pepper jack jalapeno thing. We both got onion rings.  Those had to be some of the best burgers we'd ever had. Maybe it was because of all the buffet food, I don't know, but I know, now that I'm home that I'm craving that burger again. Nice waitress, crappy lemonade, and no lines! I'd go again for that burger alone!

2079HOLb_rZbeoXmiK5M_g.text: Got a comped breakfast here before we left Vegas.  If I had to pay for it, I may have given it one star.  The service was SLOW.  We finally had to ask for our waitress because she was nowhere to be seen.  I had an egg white omellette and it tasted like pure butter.  It was edible, but not much more than that.   The hashbrowns were alright because there was enough crispiness to make them decent.  The best part was our stellar busboy.  He kept our Diet Cokes coming all meal long.  Unless it is free, I would pass on the Pyramid.

saPrYU_uEE9vSZ_uApKTew.text: So the scenario here is that I spent the last several hours at the Spearmint Rhino, came back to the hotel, won over $100 in 2 minutes at roulette, and find myself locked out of my room... and it's 6:30 am, and I need to catch a 10:30 am flight.  I could just ask for another key, try to catch an hour or two of sleep, and head out, but instead, I let my stomach do the talking, and on the way back down to the registration desk, I pass the Pyramid Cafe.  I go in, and was thinking steak and eggs, but instead, go for corned beef hash.  The food was excellent, but I think that was just because I was starving, and the "Chinese" food I had at Shanghai Lilly the night before had already completely worn off.  The waiter was nice and accomodating, but nothing too special.

7YCWbLIg_R6uNvxkhoiSJw.text: Had my hangover breakfast here.   Everything was just fine except the scrambled eggs. . . . they were strange & fake like?? Not sure how you can screw up scrambled eggs so I am taking 2 stars off for that.   Service was excellent and so were the pancakes.

dOtavgMKOGGJkCc8ETlcmA.text: Fast service and the grilled ham and cheese was decent too.  They charged $9 for a mimosa and $9 for a split of champagne so I ordered the split and asked for a small glass of OJ.  So basically I got two mimosa for the price of one.  Whoo hoo!

jb4hWFp91cbeGd-s4Wugiw.text: I ate here twice on my recent trip to Las Vegas.  Breakfast was okay, but avoid the waffles unless you like them dry and tasteless.  Go with the pancakes.  Grilled cheese sandwich was okay -- not the best, but not a greasy mess either.  Avoid the nachos.  They were so bad the waitress had them removed from my bill.  French onion soup -- you take your life in your own hands if you eat the Durkee fried onion pieces on top.  Servers are pleasant.  They are great with refilling your Pepsi-product beverages.  The cafe is clean.  You could bring a large group here and no one would mind.  Its a good pit stop for a snack, not a gormet meal.

5Mpktdn_gErhEyS8HfP31g.text: Filet and eggs were the way to go. The meal was inexpensive (for Vegas) and flavorful. The toast was awesome and while the waitress seemed overwhelmed, she was friendly and attentive.  The food came quick and the place was clean.  Definitely worth a visit if you are in the casino.

e27aMjeh8p6MozBJLmunFA.text: This place is pretty average.  It's a decent option if you find yourself wandering around Luxor on the verge of starvation, but definitely not a place that you should seek out for any legitimate reason.  I had the fish and chips, which were quite greasy but not terrible.  The GF had the Monte Cristo, which was apparently inedible.  I can't say that that I was expecting much, so I wasn't disappointed.

o7kVPPr_rmKMi5tsAeUa2Q.text: Coffee here was good, the Eggs Benedict was actually pretty good, and my wife had a corned beef sandwich on rye, and the service was pretty good - not too pushy, not inattentive.    Moral of the story for us, after visiting is: the better hotels have a better breakfast spot.    Nothing spectacular, but if I were to stay in the Luxor, I would definitely hit  this place up and not really bother to venture out when I could get something pretty good for a reasonable price in a pinch.

dEv6l-HQDf0FIb8xB5hLcQ.text: It might not be King Tut worthy, but it got the job done for me! There aren't a huge number of dining options at Luxor, and as a result I landed here. It is bright, spacious and clean, which is always a nice start to a meal. The menu has something for everyone I'm pretty sure; the service is quick, and the prices are reasonable. My choice: a simple soup and salad combo. The salad was mixed greens with basic vegetables, and the blue cheese dressing was just right. The tomato soup wasn't mind-blowing. It was a close relative to Campbell's. Nothing to be ashamed about. The only thing I truly missed was a basket of warm bread. Otherwise, an acceptable choice for when you're hungry, not looking for anything too fancy and you happen to be at the Luxor.

2DyVYiqR6nwOW4kUPw9_0g.text: Much better than your average cafe. Lots of choices, okay prices, service is good!

H4GwvsmQyHE4AFnNdPe0mA.text: IT WAS SOOOOO GOOODDD! PEOPLE WHO SAID IT WAS BAD ARE TROLLS. The buffets at Le Village in Paris and the buffet at Caesar Palace are nothing compared to this! Must try their steak and egg breakfast. It was A-MAZING!

ABPVaZdcfqUIcocheP86Sg.text: Slow as f... I mean, molasses. Kind of a trap if you want breakfast and don't want a buffet that has been touched and picked through by random strangers. Anyway, they need more staff. Saturday around noon, which I assume is one of the busiest times at a casino cafe, there seemed to only be four servers - all who seemed overwhelmed by the volume of patrons. The food was pretty good. Hubby and I split the artichoke spinach dip and a chicken caesar sandwich. The dip was really good and garlicky. The sandwich, while it didn't look all that appetizing, was really tasty. It was served on foccacia with a big slice of swiss. Took three tries to get an iced tea. Definitely go before you are in the omg-i-need-to-eat-right-now hunger zone.

zKuje2oawBvJ24uqExbQsA.text: This cafe was hardly full at 4 am, but somehow we ended up waiting like an hour for our food. When we got our food, half the orders were incorrect and when they did correct them, they sucked. I know when you are drunk and partying all night, you should be able to eat anything, but this was not the case with this joint. Waitress ignored our group most of the time.

3I6G8Sv_OH7sExTPU0xk6g.text: The food here always hits the spot. The steak and eggs are good. The steak is always juicy and the hash browns and eggs are always good. They serve fresh squeezed Orange juice. The oatmeal and waffles are also good. Their burgers are okay, I've had better. Their menu is quite small and it's a bit expensive. I would like to give it a higher rating but they seem to under staff the place. You have to wait to be seated and half the place is empty. Then when you're seated the service is a toss up but most likely a bit slow. The food is good so I will continue to come here on Vegas trips.

NdZxsT5tJbgnlJk3JiV0pw.text: This is a decent hotel casino cafe in Vegas. We stopped here for a brunch after waking up late our first day here after a late night =P   I got the San Francisco Club - nothing too surprising, which is definitely a good thing when you get something as standard as a club sandwich. They went a bit overboard with the mayo, but otherwise okay.  Not the greatest, but not the worst... a-ok.

bQVymMnDJ-Bl5mwxoT_kxA.text: Definitely not a must stop, but if you're hungry and its after 2am, you really dont have any other choices. The place is open 24hrs and is very busy late night as all the drunks leave the Vegas night clubs. Service is slow at best (took 15 mins and me asking 2 different people before I finally got a glass of water). The food is not very good and patrons & staff seem to have a combative relationship. I suggest hitting up the upstairs food court or the Backstage Deli if its still open.

6txriPq6ACD7yrVgzslihA.text: Horrible. Do not bother. Arrived at 8:45am. No wait, plenty of seats. They choose to sit us by the kitchen. Ordered a coffee for my fiance and a water for me. They brought both drinks to me specifically. The water was disgusting, tasted like dish water.  We ordered the Eye Opener and Hash & Eggs.   My fiance's eggs were over easy and looked like they were microwaved. Her syrup was watery.  The Hash was dry and flavorless. It was hard to differentiate the hash and the hash brown flavor and texture.  The wait staff would ask a question mid power walking past our table. They never stuck around for an answer.  Will not return.

unUe04yNPtCYoi4QZjBw1Q.text: I met my Aunt at the Pyramid Cafe for lunch when I was in town visiting and we each got the breakfast combo - two eggs, bacon, homefries and silver dollar pancakes.  The breakfast was alright, though the pancakes were really weak - they were thin and tasteless. If you have time, I'd recommend going to another hotel to grab some quality food.

DqiZwEdfCJ-3mY4Egs6n-g.text: This was my experience this past Saturday.  We had a long wait to get in (I could overlook it).  The waitress rushes us to table, not letting me get a word in that we'd prefer a booth.  When she lets us get a word in she says "next time you should say before we sit you so you don't have to walk across the restaurant."  So despite there being over 10 booths open, she has us go wait by the register again.  We finally get a table.  The waiter is frazzled.  The meal was not the most delicious.  In fact, I wish we had gone to Denny's.  At least I wouldn't have been disappointed.  I never got my toast and our drinks were never refilled.  It took over 30 minutes to get our check and our change.  When we did get our change, we were short changed and had to go back to ask for our $5 they shorted us.  Will not visit again.  Save your money and go elsewhere.

MZTIhRaYJ4d8EjVP97Rmaw.text: Pretty Good food but how on earth did I spend $64 on a basic breakfast for a party of 3!? Oh my bad the juice & coffee was $4 and soda was $3.50!! Crazy

Vfoiw_aQWybigyGhVzqa8Q.text: Surprisingly good breakfast, and if you get the right assistant, you will never see the bottom of your coffee cup.

XUB6V9yvz8cL-mcTjgsFFA.text: I went there with my two young girls. We had the spaghetti & meatballs and the pizza. Both dishes were OK, nothing to write home about, but the quality and taste you can expect from your typical family restaurant across the country. Prices were a bit high in general, but moderate for Las Vegas. Portions were quite generous. Service was quite good. In all, I wouldn't rush back but I wouldn't avoid it either. Full review at marga.org/foodblog/2011/...

LR8jdMhE0Gp_v_N71TpWLg.text: Every time I wanted to go there they were closed! This place should be 24hrs, not closed certain sections of time.

cYII400PZQ5yeKMLtx4EQw.text: We stayed at The Luxor (mistake #1) and found this place to be the only restaurant in the hotel to get some eggs and bacon (to order) to clear up the hangover.  We went twice while we were in Vegas.  Here's why it sucked:  1)  The line is so so long even though more than half the tables were completely open.  They just refused to sit us. 2)  The service is TERRIBLE.  When I asked for waters the waitress rolled her eyes at me and disappeared for ten minutes. 3)  Poached eggs came in a small dish on the side, swimming in water.  While blotting the eggs on a napkin, my yolk broke.  That just sucks. 4)  We ordered turkey sausage and they brought greasy pork sausage.  When I pointed that out, the waitress told me we were wrong and that it was obviously turkey.  No. Pork. 5)  Underseasoned and bland hash browns.    What's good:  1)  Uhm... bacon.  Bacon is always good.  For what this place charges and for it being the only real breakfast spot in the hotel, I wished for a lot more.  Thankfully, I'll never step foot into the Luxor again after our experience which means I'll never have to eat at the Pyramid Cafe again.

BSZp_F_dxHwFS3EVptuMKQ.text: We ate here because it was in the hotel and close to where my friend and my husbands had been playing. The food was atrocious my hubby pancakes were nasty bland flavorless steak with super sweet syrup and way to much butter and I only hate part of the Ham and cheddar melt I'd ordered it was not crisp very greasy and came with lackluster limp fries and My firend and her husband didn't seem to enjoy there entree a turkey Panini and steak either. The waitress was over touchy with our husbands as well and my husband actually noticed this which means it was excessive because he never notices when a girl is flirting with him lol. I know that some people are touchy I am I love to hug my friends but constantly rubbing another woman's husbands arm or back is offensive. I hated the food and the service was ok I got my food and drinks and my husband got a massage lol

do_K1gGswwkJ8TpFnXpcFQ.text: Food was very tasty. I recommend the red velvet pancakes. The wait staff was great. Only down side is price just like everything in Vegas.

JSyHKlVJaey0q3Wth_Xlww.text: So we arrived at the Luxor late on a Monday night and the only thing open was this Pyramid Cafe - their 24 hour place.  We waited in line at midnight for over 20 minutes.  When we were seated, our drink order was taken right away, but we waited about 15 minutes for a server to come over.  It wasn't all that busy, but there were only 2-3 servers on duty and a schmuck of a manager strolled around not helping very much.  He should have taken off his jacket and got his hands dirty.    I ordered onion soup and M had pizza.  The food tasted okay, not bad, but not great.  It definitely wasn't worth the wait.  The food was overpriced (ya, I know, it's Vegas).  Next time we will drive somewhere to eat late.

-hvTF-T2Y3pe0BO7RROu8Q.text: What to say about the Pyramid Cafe. The experience was just 'meh'.  We ate here because we were staying at the Luxor and were too lazy to drive anywhere else. It was sort of last minute at 9pm so we settled. Even at 9pm the place was busy and we had to wait for a table.  When we sat down it took a while for a server to get to us. Everyone working there looked harried, stressed and overworked. When we finally got served our server was very nice and did the best she could to get around to us. Ironically there were several men standing around who looked like managers who werent doing much at all to assist the staff even though they clearly needed it. Also, I saw a server loudly complaining about a customer to the manager within earshot and sight of the entire dining area. This is such a pet peeve of mine.  The food was just ok. We ordered a Cobb salad and salmon burger. The Cobb salad was pretty boring and predictable. The salmon burger was alright, maybe slightly undercooked, pretty small and not terribly interested.   If I had to do it all over again I would make the extra effort to find another place to eat. Our total bill came to around $28 which certainly wasnt worth what we ate.

6nRhJBbawF62BMHFMgMUtw.text: Nice casual dining location with delicious food after a night out in Vegas. I enjoyed a Bistro cheese sandwich and salad and we shared a espresso martini for dessert which had a great kick to knock us out of our food coma while satisfying the sweet tooth!

9_zO9AaS_y3ZCeI_0Mgi4A.text: Finally was able to make it to the Pyramid the day we were leaving.  Oh how I wish they were open 24hrs, we would have eaten here every day.  I was pretty tired and hungover, so not much appetite, but the bagel and cream cheese hit the spot. Everyone else's food looked great, too.  The service was good, we didn't have to wait for a table even though the place was bustling and the prices were reasonable.  Pyramid Cafe, increase your hours so people don't have to suffer at Raffles!!!

sY_JMxOWtgQw86PfXQC62A.text: If I could give zero stars I WOULD! This place sucks, service is extremely slow. My waffle was ice cold inside, obviously still part frozen. Just don't come here...you're in Vegas. Go to Denny's if you want this...it'd be better. So regret coming here and wasting two hours of our morning. SO UPSET!

IqeWsq-yewq08PDMawofnw.text: I don't care how you dress this place up, its still a fake Denny's. I know a Denny's when im in a Denny's and this is a damn Denny's called the Pyramid Cafe at the Luxor.  Stop Lying Vegas! Stop Lying!

clEb157vxKiNbjgks2i-Uw.text: We stayed at the Luxor for our wedding/honeymoon/vacation. We ended up eating here pretty much every morning before starting our day, and it was a good way to wake up. The staff there was really friendly the entire time (except one lady, who was actually too friendly and a bit touchy feely for us) and our food came quickly. Coffee was average diner coffee-- Folgers in your cup kind of deal. The food was pretty basic, but a good portion and a good value for the money, and they always brought the check out quickly as well. It saved us time-- and if you are in the hotel, it's the way to go for breakfast.

4M0dT9XLfuzCtTPYqPLzng.text: Split the san Francisco club with my boyfriend. Very yummy and hearty. Quality ingredients, above average ,"cafe" food. We ordered fries and an extra side-coleslaw. We'll pass on the slaw next time. Would definitely eat here again.

1NGo7GxfaPvpsi6aysiYhQ.text: I was looking for Blanche or Flo but it was their night off   What I love about cafes or diners is that their menus are full of anything that you can eat with the exception that you take shots as if there was an alcohol shortage in the nation & that you danced like a maniac (literally like a maniac) on the floor...it's not only a song, it's a dance of redemption   And what's more perfect in Las Vegas than a cafe located on the heart of the main casino just a couple floors down from your room  I've got to give cool points to our waiter at the Pyramid cafe because like everyone in our table he was also super annoyed at the drama queen next to our table, voiced his opinions about it to us & gave us our awesome meals on time to end the night/early morning. I would've hugged him if he brought out a frozen t-bone & slapped Queen drama next door. Just kidding...I'm not violent but pretty imaginative though  not in that "Saw" movie kind of way  The only thing is that the lines were way too long which is great because that means that people loved the food served here but I saw a couple of empty tables on the side while we were waiting. Tipsy, hungry & TIRED are the worse combination and that's nuff said while breaking into new 5 inch heels especially when you see empty tables set up & ready.  Overall, this was the place to find comfort food such as my delicious Vegetarian omelet, a huge mix of fresh spinach, tomatoes & mushrooms with fluffy white & yellow eggs, wheat toast, side of fresh fruit & the sweetest yet strong coffee. Yum!  Ending this review now because I am stuffed from this hearty meal and ready to zzzzzzzz  Wake me at 12 noon...ahhh Vegas

gflx3mAzi4iG20NOUz19eA.text: I'm so glad I found this place.  All the times I have been in the Luxor and I have never noticed it...I'm a little disappointed in myself.  Came here for brunch Saturday, ordered the tuna salad sandwich (not something I typically order at a restaurant ever) but something was telling me to order it....and I am so glad I did.  It was the most amazing tuna salad I have ever had.  I also got the coleslaw for a side and that too was delicious.  I also had a bite of my friends fish and chips....just as tasty!  Everyone at the table was beyond please with their dishes, so in the future I will definitely make my way over to this nice cafe.  The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because of the service....granted it was Saturday near lunch hour....but no personality whatsoever...came and ran (literally, so he was hustling)...but breath, slow down a minute and enjoy your friendly customers.

UrHmof8Iwl5T_9bIr2nIRA.text: Great staff, greasy and overpriced food. You'd get a better sandwich from the Starbucks next door. Do NOT get the coffee. It was vile and tasted like it had been sitting there all day.

QpgdT680rjraQY4TqqGC1A.text: Friendly prompt service, a fair price and tasty food. If you are staying at the Luxor and need breakfast, give the pyramid cafe a chance.   I ordered the French Toast and my wife had a bagel with Cream Cheese.   Was it the best I ever had, no.  Was it tasty, hot, and reasonably priced, yes.   You do not go here for gourmet but you will get good food and a friendly server.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu from the breakfast side. Moderate price cheap for Casino food.

V9pFxDDOOvy3NglbFWWlnQ.text: Giant breakfast here.  I had the eggs with a bunch of veggies.  Came with a chunk of crispy hashbrowns.  Service was really good considering how busy they were.  They drop off a pitcher of coffee too.

nlcGiTf8EzIsfd87WmpwdA.text: Good service and delicious food  I had vegetarian omelet plus side pancakes  Fresh coffee and good place to come and have food

eVo36X8k87siU38b_M_-ew.text: Only ate here because I had comp dollars for the hotel so it was free. I would not spend my actual money here. The "breakfast" is mediocre, especially for the price. Eggs were rubbery and the pancakes I had to saw through. Vegas is too big to settle for a place like this, do yourself a favor and try experiencing another restaurant. I suggest the other restaurants in Luxor or the food court. Not worth trying this place at all, maybe the lunch is better but as far as the breakfast goes.... don't bother. I normally try to find the good in places but not here.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First time I&#39;ve never finished food.

0lZaNwgOMmvfpuhMsSD6pw.text: My husband and I recently stayed at Luxor, so we thought it would be convenient to eat at the Pyramid Cafe before we headed out to go exploring in the desert. Boy, were we wrong. This place served the worst breakfast I have ever had. My husband and I ordered omelets served with hash browns. The omelets were cold and the topping were laying on top rather than mixed inside the eggs. Spinach was not chopped but rather just a few leaves laying on top. The eggs were unlike the texture or taste of real eggs instead they were the kind served in school cafeterias, egg beaters, perhaps? The hash browns were standard undercooked from a bag with no flavor. This meal with nothing extra was going to cost over $40.00!! I could not manage to choke down this meal so I told the waitress how unsatisfied I was and she deducted the price of one of our meals. Denny's McDonald's Starbucks any of these restaurants would have been better for far less.Don't even go here out of convenience! There are too many other options in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelets don&#39;t look like this

yycb-S8U9dNmQsxFIn7Y9w.text: Back for an encore!! We are back in Vegas after 5 years to reprise our honeymoon and also get away pending the birth of our 2nd baby girl   The food and service and ambiance are still excellent. The coffee was much better than Starbucks (which are EVERYWHERE on the strip and come on the coffee just isn't that great), and I got the Croissan' wich. The eggs are nice and fluffy, the croissant buttery, the fried potatoes are heaven. The only possible upgrade would have been cheddar cheese instead of American but oh well. Husband, who loves chicken and waffles, had just that and declared it the best chicken and waffles he's ever had!  (Unfortunately I learned definitively that daughter #2 does not like eggs. Boo!)  10/10, definitely recommend!

0Pnjenp4wvYZBIdk_Prqtw.text: Fast service, I ordered to go and the ladies and servers were really nice. I ordered garden Benedict and pyramid classic. They both were good. Very fulfilling.

qkvAqe2DVHPZyfMzb2nYOQ.text: Do not waste your money on a buffet in Vegas! This place is only open until 2 PM, but every portion and items are received will have a wow factor. Every item is scratch made, with extremely quality ingredients. If our current president was writing this review he would say "their stuff is great, they have great stuff, they have the greatest stuff, stuff that no one else has stuff". The portions are huge, a stack of flapjacks is seven dollars but it is actually two giant pancakes. One pancake is enough and that dish is easily shareable. My favorite dish I had there was the parfait, it is homemade granola with nuts that have been beautifully roasted to where they are soft but still retain some crunch, there are berries that are freshly dried and still a little bit tender and juicy with burst of flavor, it's layered with Greek yogurt, fresh berries and topped with a big chunk of honeycomb. My husband's favorite was the breakfast burrito, it has chicken, sausage, chorizo, cheese, eggs and comes with a beautiful spicy molcajete salsa. There are plenty of choices in Vegas for where you can eat but if you want to quality meal, for a fair price, that is going to stuff you for the entire day while you're walking 10 miles through casinos I definitely recommend eating here.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simple, delicious and fast

9N49aHFj4BeQ_SmDdKrHDg.text: We came here for breakfast everyday during our stay. The service was fairly quick and the food was good. I don't recommend paying for fruits as an add on for your pancakes/waffles because they put no emphasis on the dish. Overall, it's a great place !

7bFdnurlD-eJtSVYhb1IVg.text: Hey this place is in the Luxor so... but went for breakfast and let me tell you the portions and the service were tremendous! Had the pyramid stack pancakes and there is no way you can eat all of those, ate 4 and I think 4 were left non eaten - husband got the hash and he loved it, only complaint he had was only one piece of sourdough instead of the usual 2. Service was tremendous and attentive to our every need.

gtMGc41M3AQa3LR71v9epA.text: Service is extremely slow and the servers have quite an attitude. Drinks are extremely weak. Prices are high for what you're getting. Would not recommend this restaurant to anyone until a major overhaul is done.

M7DJrtod0rQWrY4LxsWZbQ.text: We came here for breakfast. The best way to describe this place is Denny's quality food at double the price.  The portions here are quite large. Each plate easily feeds two people.  The service was fast and attentive.

idk-WTFP3QdjWKtAF4UjJA.text: The breakfast was not the best. The breakfast burger could have been better. The pancakes one of my family members got were decent . Overall, the food was not that good but service was decent.

_t6lWc4KaG3uL4ig3RjOGg.text: My omelet and hash browns were lukewarm. I think I would have been better off in the buffet downstairs where the omelets are cooked fresh to order and dropped from the pan to your plate.

zpGLCw5eSw-qdV_o3-lD9g.text: Casual fare, good food, reasonable prices, friendly service.   They close too early though, would love to see them open later than 1pm!

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $6 Mimosas!

Ik8A1wvVYlxVCRdELgU0Yw.text: Horrible service for the price of food. If you're concerned at all about time just go elsewhere in the hotel/resort.

xocE8TOHiWxovjg88xtZJw.text: Came to this resturaunt and NONE OF THE PICTURES seen on this app is on the menu.  Needless to say I was very very disappointed. So I'll  give them a zero star if I could but since I can't ill give them a 1 star...    Very over priced fot very basic food

AXQxGR0FwsuWz9RCXZewDw.text: Service was good.  Food was ok.  Very expensive.  Not enough smaller options for breakfast.

qoYuwnOT0XgWbSjVG0lHqg.text: Taking off a star because it took forever to place our order!! There was a line for breakfast but moved very fast. Food is nothing extraordinary but breakfast items were tasty and well prepared. Surprisingly great coffee!! Seven pancake pyramid was huge but pancakes so fluffy and well made they they melted in your mouth. Smoothies and frozen drinks are not their strongest menu items. Overall good place for breakfast and nice atmosphere.

asYcQT4tZqAVn_Ade7YDuA.text: I got the all-american breakfast with the sausage links.  The hash browns were bland and not crispy, the eggs were a bit runny (I got scrambled), and the sausages were meh.  It's like a really bad Denny's, but more expensive.

bbKz4TgHOcllbDFnUGUaXw.text: "grilled cheese search"  So the gay boyfriend and I stumbled in here late Sunday night in search of grilled cheese. It's not on the menu but if you ask nicely, they will make it for you for $7.99.  I ordered the chicken noodle soup and the San Francisco club. The soup was so-so. There was a lot of chicken and maybe this was slightly healthier than a canned soup? The sandwich was way too bready and by the end of the meal, I was eating just the filling (turkey was very salty but the bacon was thick!).  With two drinks, our bill topped out around $40 after tax and tip.  Probably not worth a sober meal but I think it saved us from a morning of a horrible hangover.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Wujh0YBWQfm06qhT3fs0Bg.text: Fairly unimpressive spot.  They offer the typical breakfast items you'd expect, but nothing that was fantastic or memorable.  Nothing on the menu actually looked very good so I just ordered a salad - that was fine.  I sampled a few dishes from friends' plates and nothing was very good:  -tough scrambled eggs -dry bread -overcooked omelets  I would not go back unless forced to.

iYD0MaG1DA5YB80Qa2GEFQ.text: Had to eat breakfast here 3 times before we left. The breakfast food is very very high quality, and loved it. They have a nice variety of things to choose from, from biscuits and gravy to strawberry shortcake waffles to oatmeal and fruit.

1RzxrVeaLyzk9W0drXVMsw.text: Service and staff were nice and friendly. I ordered the Monte Crisco, which was the ham and turkey french toast sandwich. The though of it was good, but I felt like the inside of the sandwich was undercooked. The sandwich itself was too thick to get the egg cooked or at least hot on the inside.

cV-bZhra30XrQ9PD8mvhig.text: Small menu but good. Nice waitress. Had burger and fries. Good. Wait was normal. Not fast but not slow. I do think that earning points on the M card should get u more like a free meal here.

dCsh66QbMtNO7AmnJyB8Uw.text: Great service, Great food, Great Price.  I had a large group of people with me and the staff were attentive in all of our needs. We were seated in 10 mins, drinks came out immediately, food came out in about 25 mins.  Portions were decent, worth the price.  Not a lot of 24hour cafe's have good service like this so I would come here again if I stayed close to the Luxor.

bTY_XW8J4E_CFmYHeBtivg.text: Of all the restaurants we went to this one was the least appealing. The service was nice, but something was lacking...i can't quite put my finger on it though. I like Denny's and the workers just seemed one level below there.  The prices were low and food was really tasty, but nothing over the top fabulous. I also had one Mojito which was also very tasty and had a stick of sugar cane in it to chew on, yum! That was the icing on the cake.

qlrugvrOJI8fjKfWi-BsTQ.text: While this is just your standard hotel cafe, this place fails on all counts.  Over the years I have stayed at the Luxor a lot, and every time it always seems to be the same problem, and the only reason this place continues to get my business is because when I eat there I am normally hung over and don't want to mess with anything else.  I have only ever ate here for breakfast, but the food is always consistently pretty bad, and the service is always pretty terrible.  This last trip I got an omelet that was smothered with way to much cheese, and for being a steak omelet, it has about 3 small pieces of steak inside, that tastes like it was microwaved.  I got some toast with my omelet and it tasted like it was 10 days past its prime, and I couldn't even eat it.  The servers always seem to be rude here, and are in no hurry to take your order, and in even less of a hurry to bring it out to you.  Does everyone at the table want their food brought out at the same time?  Better not hold your breath, that is another thing they aren't in a hurry to do either.

I0BVDv6vcq41vyhm9mmChQ.text: If I could give 0 stars to this place I would! First thing we got seated quicky that was the only thing good in the beginning. The person who attended us and ask what drinks we would like was very nice and quick and always checked up on us to see if we needed more drinks. Now on the other hand out waiter was awful!!! Like literally awful!!! It took him 1 hour and 20 minutes to bring out our food and he brought out everyone's food out at the same time and he didn't know who's food was what. He brought the wrong food for the wrong people. He kept dropping stuff on the floor and spilling people's drinks, sweating excessively, shaking, pacing back and forth!!!! I mean it was awful!! I feel bad for him but I don't know what was wrong and a few minutes later I saw him being escorted out but authorities!!!!! Awful experience!!! My friend left to eat somewhere else. Everyone was complaining!!! Avoid this place!!!! Manager was very nice and gave us a refund!!! Thanks to her!!!!

G6eov6VD1hR5FYzzjyJu5g.text: First time here...won't be the last :-).  I had the country benedict...eggs were perfect...biscuits were fresh and grilled just right...sausage was tasty and not too salty...gravy was FANTASTIC.  The hash browns were perfectly crunchy on the outside and moist...but not raw...on the inside.  Orange juice is freshly squeezed and sweet...really pleasant. Service was attentive and just right..checking on me without becoming annoying.  Coffee was constantly topped off.  The only thing that wasn't top notch was the coffee..it's coffee...like the coffee I've had at many diners...nothing special.  I recommend you try this place out...I expect you'll come back again too :-).

VGTI2xJjrWCNditMoFGrLw.text: Price about what you would expect at a strip hotel cafe. We ate twice on our trip here. I had the steel cut oats both times and the price on those was good. No kids menu so both of my kids had regular order of pancakes on first breakfast here. They should have shared one and still would have had one pancake left over. Took the leftovers and used them as snacks as we walked the strip. The second visit they shared a plate.

5u3R-BdG5IngfwlAh7UexA.text: I had breakfast here.  It was bad.  I think I have cooked better breakfasts with a hangover.  Also, you are smack dab in the middle of Luxor.  The place seems out of place.  It seems as though they had some extra space and the Pharaoh at Luxor said "Ah...well let's just put a crappy cafe and charge prices that are too expensive and maybe people will think it is trendy."  The result is that it becomes a tourist trap.  Do not go here.    I got pancakes...you wouldn't think they can mess up pancakes...well the Pyramid succeeded.  It was as if the pancakes were made by a 3 year old, and that 3 year old had no arms, no kitchen supplies, no burner (I swear they cooked them on a radiator), and the 3 year old had a grudge against me. It is as though they wanted me to have a horrible experience...like the chef gets a bonus if people hate his food.  "No!  Don't use sugar in the pancake mix...use MSG...that will make it taste nasty...we don't want these people liking this food...how horrible would that be?"  Seriously...the pancakes tasted salty as though somebody mixed up the sugar and salt.  How cliche is that?

P82_nnP4Y3KxaSM-Lvl5wA.text: It was late and we found ourselves at the Luxor and looking for a late dinner. The Pyramid Cafe is open 24 hours and looked appealing with its half circle banquettes and view of the bustling casino.  I ordered a favorite I hadn't had in years, a Monte Cristo ($11.95) sandwich.  It was served with ample amounts of ham, turkey and cheese and cooked to the proper golden brown along with a very nice strawberry preserve.  The sandwich was good, but the French toast could have been better.    My wife had the California Turkey Panini topped with cheese, avocado and tomato ($11.95) served on a ciabatta roll.  Tasty enough but not pressed or grilled in any manner.  Huh, what's up with that?  We saw another patron get served the same thing and watched the quizzical look on his face as he lifted the top of the uncooked roll.     Is the "press" in the kitchen on the fritz or the executive chef doesn't know that most people expect a grilled Panini when that word (we're not in Italy) is used.   Now that I think about it, how can you press a sandwich with tomato and avocado on it?   Maybe they should rename it the warm Pyramid Cafe turkey sandwich.   Next time I'll go with the all day breakfast.

sM8APvm49cUBHn-Wu45MCA.text: Food is good, price is reasonable for a restaurant in casino, SERVICE IS HORRIBLE!!! We waited 15 mins for someone to take our orders and another 20 mins for the food to be on our table. The server had an attitude when I asked her for a to go box and refills on the coffee.

DMS8ThI0SEKjRCymjQBm6g.text: Went to the cafe around midnight and it was pretty empty. The service was ok, food could've been better. I think it was a bit over priced for the quality, but it is a cafe inside a Vegas Hotel. If you're starving and need a place to eat, that is inside a hotel, this is a good place to go since it will most likely be open.

UT9SI8PDN--s3U_Marb-vQ.text: Along one end of the Luxor in the center casino area is the Pyramid Cafe. It's mostly a small area raised a few feet off the pyramid floor. There aren't really walls, so it does give you a view of weary, ragged-around-the-edges folks mindlessly working the slots at 3 am.  There's a fairly broad menu ranging from burgers to 24 hour breakfast. Out of sheer convenience, I ate here twice; once a breakfast type meal and the other dinner. Although different foods, the experience was similar.  Both times service was pretty slow, even when the place was only partly full and the number of patrons barely outnumbered the servers. Breakfast came with a nice helping of ham but runny eggs and wilted hash browns. A burger for dinner was okay; I rather liked the fries that came with it, but it was a pretty small helping. Prices had the expected resort markup.  I give two stars here, not that it's a particularly bad place, but it just seems to do everything a little below average. There's nothing egregious here and I'd eat here again in the right circumstances, but everything is sort of a C-/D+ level. I'd say that this is best for a basic meal if you're in the Luxor area or for a 4 am chowdown after a night on the town.

EUFYGaJWg30TByFaBcZPWQ.text: Excellent 24 hour cafe. Their pizza is quite good, and their affordable breakfast hit the spot too.   Nothing out of this world, but definitely one of the best 24 hour hotel spots I've experienced in Vegas. Given that a good meal in this town is often needed at 4AM and this place can deliver it, I've gotta provide an extra star.

ZycqArk9ETiWQY5fzZvZjA.text: Probably the worst tasting food I has ever eaten.  Plus, the service was like a person giving lines in a play. Saying what needed to be said and not listening to the responses and having a Stepford Wife like fake smile the entire time.

sROtiDSp2UVYk1CePK7DbQ.text: We grab brunch here as we we head out for our flight.  The ambiance is of a diner...with Egyptian hieroglyphics and stuff.  Luxor really need to make up its mind, is it modern and sleek? or Egyptian and kitschy?  I had the chicken pot pie and thought it wasn't bad.  The crust was flaky and the chicken and vegetables were nicely cooked.  I got full half way through but ended up devouring the whole thing.  The complimentary bread and the corn (?) bread that came with the pie were both no go.  Barely touched either.  Come here if u need to grab a quick bite or for convenience.  And with this being Vegas, prepare to pay a couple extra bucks even for a simple quick meal.

5c6vgBQ-s_sT2iJ2GgZvYQ.text: Stayed at the Luxor and this cafe is your typical "family restaurant" feel. Went fir breakfast. Presentation was surprisingly beautiful and food was great. Definitely more upscale than I thought. Great customer service as well.   Great place to stop for breakfast and lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r9ewS0OyRYa7VVk91L3ayQ.text: I came here after eight years and remembering I loved the cafe. My boyfriend and I were excited to get breakfast. The coffee was not hot and very watered down. There's no choice of milks either.   We ordered the mimosas which was great but you can't feel the effects. A pitcher is $25. When ordering food we both got the platters. I ordered scrambled eggs with cheese. They forgot the cheese, brought it into the back where I assumed they were remaking the eggs..however it came back lukewarm with a mountain of powdered cheese on top of it. I ordered sausage and received bacon, again no apologies.   We then asked for the check, it took over 10 minutes with multiple reminders. Btw it wasn't busy. Again no apologies. But he remembered to tell us he took off the bacon we never asked for. $67 and it wasn't even worth half of that.  Please just avoid this place and go up the buffets

mO_wiVzOXN9PYxM1HBtKeg.text: We stayed at the Luxor so it was fast and easy.  Typical breakfast/brunch fare.  It's bigger than it looks so even if there's a line, it moves fast.  When we were there there was a snafu with the MLife card line.  There were two lines and several people surpassed us and went to the short line.  They busted the chops of the minority family, but let and elderly white couple pass through the expedited line.  We talked to the manager and suggested some better signage.  She agreed.  And had been asking for one and felt this incident would make it possible to get one.   It's a fast breakfast place to hit before you go out on the town.  We ate here twice.  She paid for our breakfast.  It does close at 2 PM, so make arrangements!!

pCZi3LCCg2RrwOlhQxke_Q.text: The food quality is bleh. So the only reason I'm giving this place 3 stars is because of their excellent service. The waiters were very attentive and quick. We got there around 8am and it wasn't busy- so we were seated quickly and served quickly. I ordered veggie omelette with American cheese while my hubby ordered ham omelette and we got waffle on the side to share.   We only came here because we had $50 voucher and we were running out of time before we had to leave to go back to Seattle so this place was the first restaurant we saw.  Anyways omelette and waffle arrived. Waffle didn't have any whip cream which I was a little disappointed but that's fine- that's what we ordered. The omelette was really thick and there was barely any cheese inside the omelette. To my dismay the cheese was the processed cheese that you get at stores where they're individually wrapped. I was hoping for some real cheese. Also the omelette was very thick. At this point, Denny's or IHOP is better than this place.  The staff were very friendly though. The food wasn't good at all. I recommend going to Denny's or IHOP if you want better food. Otherwise the place was pretty clean.

QBf9jrn0wr1NV5n_TzXJ8g.text: When staying in a hotel that's shaped like a pyramid, it makes sense to eat breakfast at a place called the Pyramid Cafe (even if the yelp ratings suggest not going). I ate breakfast here yesterday morning because the picture looked really, really good. We got here pretty early and thanks to half of Las Vegas still sleeping we got seated and served very quickly. The hostess and are waitress were both super nice, helpful, and attentive throughout our stay. The breakfast menu is pretty much a standard menu with a few unique twists on things, like my pancakes being the "pyramid pancakes" which was basically a stack of pancakes shaped like a pyramid (which was actually just way too many pancakes). The taste? Amazing! The pancakes tasted absolutely delicious and pouring syrup on a pyramid of pancakes was very satisfying for some reason, you should probably try it as well.   Overall, my first Las Vegas breakfast was a darn good one. Both the service, environment, and food were great and it's definitely solid breakfast spot if you are staying at the Luxor.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate chip pancake pyramid, for the win.

t6dIRjr9rc-Av0R-YKcenw.text: We dined here for breakfast. The service was excellent, the coffee was fresh, and our food was good. The prices are ridiculous though. $16 for two eggs, two sausages, and hash browns.  Yikes!  I loved the wheat toast though, and I appreciated having the whole carafe of coffee to myself.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The wheat toast is bomb
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My $16 breakfast lol

sFVuzpADiprnO5rkVSqFVw.text: This restaurant is what you would expect from a hotel restaurant but I was actually impressed with my dish!  I ordered the garden benedict and I wish this is a regular for many restaurants offering benedicts.  My benedict had the ordinary Florentine benedict's but with avocado and tomatoes too!  It was actually good.  The hollandaise sauce is always either a hit or miss.  For this restaurant, the hollandaise sauce was a hit.  However, the hash browns was a little over cooked.    The hubs got the stacked pancakes and said he should have gotten short stack.  When it says stacked, they weren't kidding!    My family got turkey sandwich and croissant sandwich.  My cousin said his sandwich was good. My aunt said the croissant sandwich wasn't too bad.   If you're staying at Luxor, do stop by at this place. Although, like any resort, the price is pretty pricey!   And it is ON the strip!  If you want something more affordable, go off strip :)  Happy pyramiding!

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The garden benedict.
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The stack I mentioned in my review :)

P3rUEjGud9g_XGXZUBctxg.text: I don't know if many people know of this cafe, but I feel as if everyone should!! So here I am. We had vouchers to eat here or 5 other restaurants and I'm SO glad we chose this place!! Since it's Vegas, and we woke up late lol, we had a taste for breakfast. They serve breakfast ALL DAY! We got seated promptly, a kind waitress got our drinks right away. Then came back and was ready for our orders! Food came out quick, too!   I ordered the chicken and waffles, and honey! They were soooooo good. Their waffle mix comes with cheese and bacon mixed inside, but I ordered it with no cheese, but I did keep the bacon. The picture on the menu of the chicken and waffles looked delightful, but you can never be too positive your actual meal will come out looking like that. But it did!!! The waffles were perfect and tasty, and the chicken was moist and seasoned to perfection. If you're staying at the Luxor or just want a yummy breakfast, this is your spot!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZLpKkpTiXdNwJGX0qa3fDQ.text: Food is awful. I usually try to find something that is good about the food but I can't think of anything. From the fake scrambled eggs to the underdone tasteless bacon it was a train wreck. WAIT! I got it order the rye toast with coffee. It wasn't horrible hahaha. The $12 bloody Mary's come in a can that you pour yourself. Very classy. The service was pretty good. Feel sorry for the waitresses serving the terrible food.

bgdxJOjBgosRtOswZo4QGQ.text: Having breakfast here on 9/18/2019, food is good, coffee is great, service is excellent for $60/2 person with 2 juice, 2 coffee, one omelet and one oatmeal and 4 slide of toast.

BLN3cXsKaKX0_Pnm2OE7Mw.text: Nice breakfast spot in the Luxor. Food is delicious and the quantity is worth the price. I ordered eggs Benedict and they were amazing. Hash browns were really good and nothing beats a full bar for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle grilled cheese
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs benedict

iN8M1j9BQaBM5XO0ikUv2Q.text: I was a little hesitant to dine here after reading some of the previous posts but my breakfast experience was a great one.  I had the breakfast burrito and my wife had the pyramid pancakes.  Neither of us came close to finishing our meals as the serving size was so large.  Both of us were pleased with the quality of our meals and we're very happy with the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast menu.

j5AMJNPhMbKTMSzgDcKfCA.text: My boyfriend and I happened to walk by and noticed their menu. They had eggs Benedict, one of our favorite breakfast items, so we decided to give them a try.   We were seated promptly and our drink orders were taken. Drinks came, but no waitress to take our orders. We waited about 10 minutes and when she finally did arrive at our table, she wasn't very friendly. She took our order and went on her way.   Our food arrived and it looked great! The eggs were poached perfectly and still runny...just they way it should be! Most places always over cook the eggs on eggs Benedict. It actually was one of the best eggs Benedict I've ever had and I've had a lot! The hollandaise was perfect! Even the hash browns were delicious and cooked with just the right amount of crispiness. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal, so compliments to the chef!   The service could have been way better though. We waited too long for our waitress. She noticed we were done eating and came to clear our plates but disappeared for another 15 minutes before she came back to check on us. We were ready for our check and to be on our way!

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

owOx0hcitSVABJjZpZgBnw.text: The Pyramid Cafe is under rated! I actually really enjoyed it. I definitely read reviews and view pictures before choosing a place but considering it's hot as hell to go search for a breakfast place in Vegas and this was inside of the Luxor, I said why not! The location is on the 1st floor near the slot machines so you can't miss it. At first glance the place looks cute and clean, the waitresses were really nice upon greeting and the service was overall great. I came here twice for breakfast on my trip and I have zero complaints about the service.  The first day I had breakfast here I had the Croissant Wich with egg whites. Although the sandwich itself was delicious, it was on the oily side. I had to dab it with a napkin, they give you loads of bacon on it...so much bacon I had to remove some of it (too much for my liking). Now, the cubed potatoes they serve with this dish are dynamite! I loved them!   The second day I was here I had the 3-Way Avocado Toast and as an avocado lover I was super happy! The toast was warm and not too toasty, the avocado was flavorful and delicious, and the toppings were great! I took ate most of the olive topping toast (hence the missing third toast in the picture). For a diner, their coffee was really good! Warm and bold. Make sure you ask for flavored creamer, if you're into that!   Overall this place is great, a bit pricey but it is about two steps above a Denny's for me. I recommend this place won't hurt to try, especially if you're staying at the Luxor. Place closes at 2 by the way!

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Croissant Wich
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3-Way Avocado Toast

mmGprGmh1jGYyBNX9vPY6Q.text: At first I became iffy about this place thinking because it's in out hotel Luxor they were gonna serve us $10 meals and spike the price up to $20 plate. Well I was wrong, their way of seating, to the food and service was great. We sat down and one of the host took our drinks immediately. Shortly after our server came who was a nice gentleman who had outstanding service etiquette. I ordered the pyramid combo and my husband had the country fried steak and eggs. Everything was cooked perfectly even down to the toast which I must say was amazing. It wasn't out of the bag toast it was our of the oven toast. Yum. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants a good breakfast. We spent less than $50 including tip.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country fried steak and eggs large portion!
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pyramid combo very filling!.

oW39egxH0rtaGnOKd3sNug.text: We stopped here for breakfast since it's right in the Luxor and the pictures look amazing.  I shared a Pharoah's Pheast with my sister. It includes 6 sausages (or 3 bacon 3 sausages), hashbrown, scrambled eggs and blueberry pancakes (or regular). The portion is enormous. I mistakenly thought it would be smaller so I ordered French toast strips as well. The French toast strips come with this sweet heavenly sauce that tasted like apples to me.  This is not the cheapest option, but it's not a bad place for good breakfast food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn Beef and Potatoes.
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pharoah&#39;s Pheast and French Toast Strips.

_B8gPmUHODxpWDWq9biLSQ.text: My rating is 3.5 stars.  I remember telling my boyfriend that I was staying at a pyramid-shaped hotel and had breakfast at the Pyramid Cafe. He asked whether there were traditional Egyptian beans served at breakfast. As much as I would have loved an authentic Egyptian breakfast, this cafe is a cheaper alternative to eating at the buffet, especially for breakfast.  My friend and I headed over to this cafe for breakfast. It was busy, but there were plenty of tables for us when we got there.  I love corned beef hash. I got it with hashbrowns and scrambled eggs.  The food was hot and good. I am not crazy about crispy hashbrowns to the point where they can injure you if you threw them at someone. I'm not saying that you would, but they were too hard for my liking.   Service was fine for how busy it gets. If you are in a rush, it's probably not the place for you. Otherwise, come here for a typical North American breakfast.  (171)

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash, with scrambled eggs and hashbrowns

YlSTJQU--7xALpAPDEBG-Q.text: Pretty disappointed. I've eaten here dozens of times on my trips to vegas and often tel people to try this little diner out. Not anymore! I asked the server this time if I could substitute my hash browns for anything since I'm doing low carb, and he just said "No"..... now if there's an up-charge, I get it, but everything I asked was just "No".... kind of sad considering I'm paying a high price for Diner quality food. **shrugs** oh well. I guess I will be rethinking my breakfast options when I'm staying in vegas. Thanks for not being accommodating!

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i-4xuoSWkL_M9pmAXu_QTw.text: Just good basic all around breakfast food Great service and atmosphere go here every trip to Vegas and it never disappoints

LeEFzQX7oL_vAq5SSTVVSw.text: Great food, great service!  We shared the Garden Benedict with a side of bacon, and both of us had plenty. Imelda was there when we needed something with fast and friendly service.  Prices seem to coincide with other places on the strip.

9iAJp5GHb1mLGWA48qC5RQ.text: It's a nice, casual restaurant. I came here for breakfast with a friend. We both had omlettes with juice. I think they made it with Velveta cheese...anyway...  Service was very slow because they were short handed. Our waitress only showed up to take the order and drop the check. Someone else delivered our order.   The food was pretty good. Priced a bit on the high side for breakfast (but, I'm cheap).  I would probably come here again if I wasn't going to visit other places on The Strip.

PPl06cJLFMMCUzsO1QOwrw.text: This was disappointing in every way. I think I just ordered all the wrong dishes because everyone else around me enjoyed their food. It's an american menu and it's open at all hours of the night for those lurking for something to eat.  My French Onion Soup was basically salt in a bowl! It had very minimal broth and itwas mostly bread with a thick layer of mozzarella cheese. I was very thirsty after I had some of it. This is the worst french onion soup I have had...  The Fruit Platter for $9.99 was not worth it! A 10 dollar fruit platter came with 2 strawberries, 2 blackberries, 2 orange slices, 1 pineapple slice, 2 cantaloupe slices, and 2 honeydew slices. It was a sad looking plate of fruit.  I ordered a side of turkey sausage and was given a small plate of 4 dinky little sausages. I chose turkey sausage as a healthier alternative, but I didn't know that would include giving me a smaller portion than the pork sausages come as.  I was tempted to give 1 star... seeing as how everyone else at my table had good food in front of them i'll give them 2 stars.

ZHvPH-fQ4QxME_jEZC9SpA.text: For what it is, you can't beat it. We woke up a little hungover and weren't ready to take on a massive buffet and spend $100 so we strolled over to Pyramid Cafe. 5 min wait, friendly staff, standard diner food (they did offer mimosas and bloody mary's). For his eggs benedict and my 2 eggs breakfast with some coffees it was like $25 (a steal in Vegas!) I would return again.

qRXjJpzmqDwv8eJsrdKIUA.text: Better than expected.   We were originally going to eat upstairs in Nathan's. Due to the food court refurbishment in progress, Nathan's is temporary closed. Up for a convenient meal that was not going to cost a fortune, we tried the Pyramid Cafe.   I expected mediocre food with sketchy service. On the contrary, the Pyramid Cafe classic cheeseburger was thick and juicy. The fries were tasty. The waitress was on top of beverage refills.    Although the Pyramid Cafe exceeded my expectations, I am still not a fan. A major reason is that I could get better value at off strip casino cafes. Or Denny's. I did not see salad or soup offered with the entres. For a Strip casino cafe, the prices are not outrageous. It is my understanding that the Pyramid Cafe is the least expensive casino cafe on the South Strip [south of Paris]. Fries are included in the price of the sandwich.     Pyramid Cafe is a good casino cafe that exceeded my expectations. Knowing that there are better casino cafe values in Las Vegas, I am not a fan.

YKmLMYHBIDmjFwPnPLK3sQ.text: This was an impromptu eat spot for our little "group" because Jaime did a little too much drinkey-drinkey and needed to sober up. (they've obviously never been to a DYL).   Since I was with my (former) exboyfriend, I was *nervous* and happy and giddy so it didn't matter what the fuck I ordered as long as I took a couple bites to keep him happy, but it also didn't matter that I couldn't read the fucking menu because I was too drunk.  I was a little loud. And by little, I mean I proclaimed to the entire restaurant that my (ex) boyfriend had a red mark on his nose from some fucking accident boohoo asshole and I put makeup on to cover it up.   All the while, those dingleberrys at the table ordered some two bottles of champagne and then took my second glass away from me (or did I just drink it all?) and kept laughing at my "jokes", so it perpetuated the continuing of humiliating myself and my (asshole ex) boyfriend. Who the fuck cares?! I'M NEVER GOING TO SEE YOU AGAIN.  Also, WHERE THE FUCK IS MY FOOD. OH YEAH, ITS RIGHT THERE, SITTING UNTOUCHED AFTER ONE BITE BECAUSE IT TASTES LIKE MY ASS AFTER I'VE HAD FOOD POISONING.  Once again, really...I'm not bitter at ALL.

pHhREuxUS-KAsELkqKvT5g.text: Went here for breakfast because Excalibur sucks big time. Food was good with large portions . Wait staff was nice. A bit pricey but served as breakfast & lunch for us because of big portion sizes, so worth it. Breakfast for 5 people was a $100 including tip.

DrUmbWMei2PWN-DH7uGSQQ.text: Want try good early morning breakfast. Come to this place in Vegas on of the best in town..

lXvGSC_mV-WeBlv7wYYF0Q.text: Overpriced and slow. I watched people who came in after me get served, eat their breakfast and leave before my breakfast was served. Maybe I got a slow server. An omelet with coffee, tax and tip is $22. Not going back.

H5Mv3Xs-Pnf_BFqRKZzFkg.text: When you go into a 24 hour cafe in Vegas you will definitely expect the worst. I know I sure was when I came in here.   The pyramid cafe will surprise you, I actually got what i thought was a pretty good french dip sandwich and I was not under the influence one bit!  The chicken pot pie was pretty terrible here, but my buddy should have known better then to order that I guess.   Stick to the bar food type stuff here and you will do fine.

dR0A2s9Nwf9IugodvhErPw.text: The staff was extremely friendly and prompt.  Got seated for lunch right away. The food was good.....not great but definitely 3 stars for the food and 4 for the friendly staff.

cX_jYsFQPM2SWor7j8iSNA.text: Great to have a 24 hour cafe to go to in Vegas...   Staff was very friendly and attentive. I wanted something basic, just a ham and cheese sandwich but couldn't find it on the menu. The waitress tells me they do offer it and would place my order right away. So nice of her!!! Anyone else could have just ignored my and wait until I ordered from what was being ordered at that time in the menu. Not only did I get my sandwich but it was really good and portion made for two, and not expensive.   Two "nights" later, we were there again. Another friendly waiter, this time my friend and I shared a burger - he even split it for us, and we each got our share of fries.   Yes good food is obviously important, and they do have it, but good service is also a must to make us "fans".

vm-7yy9uYZFQZqVHlGGrvA.text: You know, the food for the most part wasn't bad.  We went there for breakfast this morning. I had the eggs Benedict, which was really good. The 'crumpets' weren't your standard english muffin, which was nice. The hashbrowns weren't crunchy enough, but still decent.  The Husband got pancakes and a side order of sausage. The pancakes were great. The sausage, however, was disgusting. Really soft and soggy with a gross flavor.   And now said Husband is sick and bed-ridden on our honeymoon, and that sausage is the suspected culprit.   Needless to say, we won't be back.

8P_6kxnvjtF5B8oZC99dtA.text: They say you don't know what you've got till it's gone...how True about the Pyramid Cafe... For as many years as I can remember, I've made it a point to eat at least one meal at the Pyramid Cafe at the Luxor.  The fact that it WAS open 24 hours a day, plus they had some delicious food (the Monte Cristo was excellent, and loved their Halibut Fish & Chips).    However, I just got back from a business trip in Vegas and stayed at the Luxor.  Signs on the Pyramid Cafe anounced that they were only open for breakfast, closed at 11am.  I'm honestly shocked and disapponted by the new hours, one less 24 hour dining option that had way better food than Denny's or any fast food joints.  I'm just hoping this was a temporary/seasonal thing, being that I was in Vegas during the "off season".  I really missed the Pyramid Cafe this time, would've loved to eat there again, but couldn't make it there during their new, limited hours.  Please go back to 24/7!!!  I want my Monte Cristo and Halibut Fish and Chips!

diPsdrCLNkKT59UBl6tf0w.text: Meh. That's all I can really say to describe this place.  My husband and I stayed in the Luxor over Labor day weekend and we decided to try out the Pyramid Cafe for breakfast. The coffee was decent. I got the belgian waffle with berries - it wasn't very warm or crispy. The price was okay for vegas though.

jHOuSjCVnYjuRU5cpPiiAQ.text: The Pyrimid Cafe is only open for breakfast and lunch.   The food is good; and interesting healthy choices are on the menu. The staff is pleasant and attentive.

1XSoMlyYGRB_E9_nSPrIkw.text: Came here because we bought tickets to Bodies Exhibition.... Gross!!!The food looked and tasted like if it had been left out for days and just reheated and served....NEVER AGAIN.

dBXxl1vfI2kEAKyQvihVRg.text: Friendly (enough) service. For some reason, Vegas seems to lack in friendly service in general, but I digress.  HUGE omelet. And toasts were really toasted to perfection! Just brown and crunch enough :D Love that! Rye went lovely with my Western omelet. Good coffee. = Good breakfast

J8QfYX0dET7kNd7fNnX0Sg.text: There are not a lot of options for food at 4am at this end of the strip.  I was worried we would have to wait forever for our food and the service would be horrible.  To my surprise the server was friendly and pretty good.  The food was ok and it came out pretty quickly.  I ordered chicken strips and fries so it was not too complicated.  I would not normally eat here, but for late night food it is just fine.

T51eppCayJK7iM7a4dCo7Q.text: Don't expect culinary food here, this is your basic Denny's with a high price.  I think I paid around $20 for a breakfast burrito and pink lemonade with tip.  The server was  nice though, and kept giving me refills.  Average food, I wouldn't waste my time here for dinner, but not bad idea for a breakfast.  This place is a good option when you are staying the luxor, and you just want to eat without having to walk miles.

pj4h7wmCk3zBPLbTCWi2yA.text: 24 hour cafe.  Better than a Denny's, nuff said.  (oh yeah, it's inside the Luxor)

v70pEc-i-Tt0StmNMdyCGg.text: This has got to be the worse place I've ever experienced in Vegas.  While walking around on our last day, a friend and I dropped in here for a late lunch at about 2pm. Just cause we wanted to eat some where relaxing and quiet. We got seated in a waiter's section that I guess was almost ready to leave and we were his last table.  When he finally came to take our order, it was the last we saw of him.  I had a coffee and a hamburger with onion rings.  After 15 minutes, our waiter had morphed into a waitress from another section who said our meals were coming right up as she ran by.  My coffee was empty so when she ran by, I asked for more and she yelled to another guy to come fill it.  He did...with coffee that was between luke warm and warm. After about 25 minutes after ordering our new waitress showed up with the food, slapped the plates down and took off before I could ask for mustard.  When I finally got the hostess' attention and asked for it, she delivered it to the the table next to us where they were just getting up to leave.  My onion rings were soggy and greasy. The onion and the lettuce on the burger was dried out as was the pickle on the plate. All was set aside on my plate never to be touched.  The hamburger itself was ok tasting and my friends NY steak and eggs was good too.  My coffee cost more than I pay for at Starbucks for a grande cafe mocha.  We only saw our waitress one more time after that and it was a drive by to tell us everything was ok instead of asking us if everything was ok.  Yeah...Our tip reflected the service we got.  Though I thought we were overly nice to give her enough to be able to play 3 times on a quarter machine.

srwNIt23C2XcrRj6jHwgEQ.text: i nom nom nommed at the pyramid cafe because of it's convenience, open 24 hours. few things are "cheap" in vegas but the cheeseburger was a good value for it's price. i got it with fries and having not eatens for almost a whole days, i still couldn't nom nom nom the whole burgers or fries. i got it to goes and they packed it with all sorts of condiments. i had enough leftovers from that nights to last me the next day but then again, i are a small cat. i was satisfied with the portions and the way it was prepared (grilled buns, nicely melted cheese, evenly cooked fries) and overall, it was a good, simple staple meal but not amazing. i would orders it again if i was cravings it though.

hWZxxkc1A3mwiFUnk0bgSw.text: They were accommodating to my hard boiled eggs request so that was cool. Our waiter talked really fast but he was probably on those "Las Vegas Drugs"..   Breakfast is good here and there is a long line that moves fast. You get your own tea kettle of hot water.. that's a plus.. Don't ask for avocados. A whole one is $8 (I almost sharted when he told me that) $5 breakfast booze beverages like mimosa's and bloody mary's -- can't beat that..  I ordered the steel cut oats and 2 hard boiled eggs.. pretty good.. Also.. Las Vegas only has Tabasco sauce..no Louisiana hot sauce.. just in case you were wondering..wish I had known that prior to.. I would have brought some packets..

CYW-xASlCOUWJV-q_3wFdw.text: Good cafe food and great customer service! Three different people kept asking us if we wanted refills on our drinks. Other restaurants don't even come back. It's not fancy but hey I would definitely eat here again :) And they have pretty good prime rib!

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The prime rib was pretty good!

oHXTapo7ygpGzW9snHaOFA.text: Came here for brealfast with my boyfriend on Saturday  morning. Even though it was crazy busy we were seated fairly quick. Our server Dante was amazing awesome interpersonal skills and a hell of a multitasker. The food came quick and overall very good, toast and omlete was so good, however wouldn't recommend the hashbrown.

B27F8VFYIzJVfZrlRoYgRA.text: Items selected: Coffee Biscuits and Jam Monte Cristo - Battered and Griddled Black Forest Ham, Turkey, Swiss, Powdered Sugar, Strawberry Preserves with Hash Browns Red Velvet Pancakes - Sweetened Cream Cheese and Chocolate Crumbles Carrot Cake French Toast - Vanilla Cream Cheese Drizzle, Caramelized Nuts Strawberry Shortcake French Toast - Lemon Poppy Seed Bread dipped in Vanilla Custard, Griddled, with Strawberries, Whipped Cream, and Strawberry Sauce   Located in Luxor, a casino I've not visited since establishing residence in Las Vegas, Pyramid Cafe was one of those All-Hours diners that I knew I'd eventually visit and with a friend and fellow blogger happy to meet up for an early breakfast the opportunity finally presented, a long walk through the parking lot and a short one through the casino landing us a table overlooking the expansive gaming floor where a craps table was already getting rowdy...or perhaps still rowdy from the night before.  Sprawling in size and comfortably spaced with a menu chock-a-block full of clever twists on breakfast favorites both sweet and savory it was to the pleasant service of a woman named Debbie that we were greeted and with the meal divided into two courses comprised of five items, including one from the mid-day menu, plus copious refills of coffee rarely would any part of the experience falter - a ninety minute visit tallying $65 all-in for one of the Strip's more innovative breakfasts.  Starting slightly savory before progressing to things far sweeter it was with the duo of three thin Red Velvet pancakes gussied up by tangy cream cheese icing and a custardy masterpiece of a Monte Cristo with fresh strawberry preserves that the meal began and although biscuits and hash browns proved somewhat uninspired as optional sides portions of each proved ample for the price.  Opting next to explore the section entitled "French Toast and Waffles" with a pair of the former the plates that arrived would prove even more impressive than round one; both "breads" actually sliced cakes dipped in custard and griddled golden, the carrot lacking much vegetable but rich with spice while the tangy poppy seed version served as base to the unbridled flavor of fresh strawberries in a dessert-come-breakfast take on a summertime favorite that should not be missed.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monte Cristo - Battered and Griddled Black Forest Ham, Turkey, Swiss, Powdered Sugar, Strawberry Preserves with Hash Browns
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet Pancakes - Sweetened Cream Cheese and Chocolate Crumbles
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu - Breakfast 6/7/14

edzdg5MR27nv-Ge7K0Ma4Q.text: First time here...Had a craving for pancakes and their portion was just perfect to compliment the rest of the food on The Combination breakfast. The atmosphere was nice at 9:30am for a Saturday morning! No wait at that time but surely enough at 10am the line was long to check in! Love the different sitting options:regular tables, booths, or an adorable table with large live seat! Good choices from classics to healthy...in case you need to rehydrate for you upcoming day! Hostess we sure to mention the alcoholism beverages available LOL! Coffee cup was continuously filled. Waiter Dante was superb! He was attentive and timely.

bX18ygCW06vgWHLyQSVhwg.text: Monte Cristo with fresh strawberry jam on the side and a boat-sized portion of fresh mashed potatoes and gravy. FANTABULOUS!  Surprisingly quiet considering the proximity to the noisy slots and people.  Waiters and waitresses were very nice. =]
