Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Quesadilla
Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monte Cristo-deep fried french toast grilled cheese with turkey, ham, and swiss =]

XD8uQt-nN7dvSUSPu1H5ZQ.text: This is what I get for being lazy. I know there are plenty of good places to eat after hours in Las Vegas, but I decided to dine here after watching Carrot Top's show simply because I was too lazy to go find something better. The 24 hour Pyramid Cafe located on the casino floor of the Luxor was quite the popular spot when I was there as there was a constant line of patrons waiting to be seated. I liken the restaurant to a Denny's based on its menu. They serve items such as all-day breakfasts, salads, burgers and sandwiches and a few main dishes. The prices are very reasonable. The staff is all pretty friendly even though I noticed quite a few of the buspersons lagging in their step and just standing around and doing nothing while there were multiple tables to be cleaned off and countless patrons waiting for a spot to sit down. After a ten minute wait I was seated. I'm not complaining, but they sat me (dining solo) in a table for four while tables for two were available forcing groups of three or four to continue to wait for a table. The whole seating arrangement just seemed way out of whack. I got a nice waitress though who constantly smiled and checked up on me multiple times. I ordered the New York Steak dinner and asked that it be cooked medium. The dinner is served with fresh seasonal vegetables which turned out to be steamed carrots and broccoli and a choice of potato. I chose mashed potatoes and made the mistake of saying yes to gravy. The wait for the food was about as prolonged as the seating process. In the meantime I was brought a basket with two warm garlic rolls and four pats of butter served cold and hard. The bread (yelp.com/biz_photos/Zosr...) was flavorful, but it was not fresh as the center was kind of firm instead of being soft. My steak dinner (yelp.com/biz_photos/Zosr...) didn't fare any better. The meat was unevenly cooked as half of the steak was served medium-well and the other half was well-done. I hate well-done steaks! I wouldn't have minded had the entire steak was medium-well since that part remained tender and juicy. Trying to cut into the well-done meat with only a semi-sharp steak knife proved to be a task as the entire table shook. The huge serving of mashed potatoes (yelp.com/biz_photos/Zosr...) might have been okay had it not been drowned in the super salty brown gravy. The best part of my meal ended up being the steamed broccoli. Pyramid Cafe, no thanks! Next time I won't be so lazy!

Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. garlic roll &amp; butter

Sji9eSnIh8_u-gDPizDYKQ.text: We ordered the skillet breakfast, pancakes, ham breakfast and let's just say there was no talking at the table! Unless our awesome waiter Derek came by to check on us, in which case there was tons of talking. Probably the nicest, friendliest servers I've ever had. He really made our breakfast experience just that much better. But seriously the food was AWESOME! Service was great! Can't go wrong!

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skillet breakfast :)

DnSFOw8ZJ71X_W3BTNRewg.text: Went here with our $35 room credit to Pyramid Cafe, Tender Steakhouse, Rice Company, or the MORE Buffet. I didn't want the buffet because I knew I'd over eat and neither did my aunt. We decided on this place around 11 AM.  The line was long, but my aunt, mother, and father were already waiting at our table. My brother and I arrived about 11, but my sister and her fiance were late! COME ON SISSY!!!  Anyway, the service was horrendous. Lizzy came with water and I had arrived with coffee in my cup which was nice (since my mom knew I'd have some). Had to ask for refills of water and coffee.  We had a huge order and I got the angus steak, eggs, and cottage cheese. I was supposed to get rye bread (didn't) and fruit (being healthy) gets an upcharge/can't be subbed. Why, why Las Vegas do you fault me for wanting more fiber, less simple sugar, and more nutrients? I don't get you!  Thank goodness for the room credit. Wouldn't have gone if I didn't have it!

LuUa-GRcJXifd5udStkVbA.text: This restaurant is located in the back of the Luxor Hotel and Casino. It is by the pool and sport/horses betting area. In general this restaurant can be compared to a Denny's or Bob Evans but a bit worse. The waitress wasn't great; however, her busser was amazing. This is a below average restaurant with below average food. My plate was a little overpriced for how buttery my eggs were (drenched in butter and oil) and how soggy the hash browns were. My boyfriend's steak and eggs looked appetizing but didn't exactly hit the mark. In my opinion the restaurant is overpriced, poorly decorated, slowly falling apart and prepares below average food.

WyuB_5pPBTc64PmzQZWBBw.text: Great place for breakfast!! I had the eye opener breakfast with a side of banana slices and a coffee. The service was quick and the staff were very nice! I was also able to get a coffee to go. It's a nice place right on the casino floor so I was worried about smelling smoke, but there was no odor.

tOIRu_Hd5fQ9Tufb7MdS7w.text: Sitting alone with a pyramid of creamers (27 of em, I counted), without a crowd, without a buffet line-up, I experienced fair prices in peace, with lovely and attentive service.  Toast is served in a basket, a glass of water large enough and fit for a King; and good, strong coffee (priced too high, a flippin $3.50 - I could so lose that kind of dinero in a slot machine!).  The menu has a nice amount of selections, and a great alternative to the buffet.

E3K02f_T38rsB10s_D5WpQ.text: Came here for bfast and it wasn't bad.  Nothing extraordinary.  Staff was nice though.

wer91b1K0QJIwrb-i-ilBw.text: Went here for breakfast since I was staying at the Luxor and I didn't want to stop at Starbucks. Nothing really spectacular here, had the "Healthy Choice" which is scrambled eggs, veggies, with a side of fruit. Food was good and got me on my way. Staff was super friendly.

JH-_8DH986Z5DQBNFpp32g.text: Well I got good service and Imelda was nice she got a tip and a Avon book who knows she might check me out on YouTube.

J0IIrQlGSbL8Qq1vCOopfA.text: Terrible service. Tried to come on Christmas, what a mistake!   Our party of three waited in line for 10 minutes with ONE table of four ahead of us.  Waited another 10 minutes at the podium with no explanation, asked to be sat at a set table nearby, told something about them cleaning a table, had them seat a couple behind us, finally got pissed off and left.   Get your staff together!  Their ineptitude is ruining your service.   Customers here have more choices and deserve better treatment than this.

af5TIiM1VvhU5nshO1-Reg.text: Great San F r an cisco club sandwich (12.99) served on sourdough bread and Monte Cristo sandwich (12.99) with fries or potato salad.  Breakfast served during lunch time too.  Raspberry  iced tea the spot.  Nice attentive servers.

uDmAqoUzFUHx-HrRCDjOKg.text: I came here with my husband on a Sunday for breakfast. He had the cinnabon french toast which was great. I had the lox with poached eggs which was amazing. It came with soooo much salmon, yum. The drinks were HUGE, delicious and reasonably priced. Will definitely be returning on the next trip.

tVhleW-FawlNROd_rwdGzQ.text: I didn't even want to give this restaurant one star ... My eggs Benedict had no flavor and was really runny ... The coffee was so strong we had to water it down and it still tasted terrible ... The waiter came for my plate and asked if was done and I said yes I didn't like it ... He never asked what was wrong with it ... And was told to add hot water to our coffee ... The reason for the one star was the steak was pretty decent and the Belgian waffle was good ... However neither the waffle or toast had butter on them

StjfeVaAYwzJ5wKWBfVyKg.text: Each of our breakfast selection was good and fulfilling. The best was that it was 24 hours and in house if you are staying in Luxor. One of the sweet places on the step with nice ambience.

3l4VzUTp7g2zAvjQBsLnfg.text: Yes, this place is overpriced. You're eating in the hotel; that's to be expected.   Still, for $13.99 (which was about $7 too much), I was able to wolf down scrambled eggs, a heaping mound of bacon, hash browns, and a small stack of silver dollar pancakes. Made for a nice hearty breakfast. Quality would be comparable to Denny's, maybe slightly better.   You eat here for the convenience of not having to slog out down The Strip looking for somewhere to grub after a long night of enjoying Vegas. In that respect, it's your best bet if you happen to be staying here.   We didn't imbibe, but they've got $5 Bloody Mary's and mimosas. Great deal if you need a little hair of the dog to get your ass moving.

ER4zGGwWO9yLhjB8i4-Jwg.text: I'm not a fan of eggs and I try not to eat too many carbs so I usually make myself a sandwich.  Unable to do so I found myself at the Pyramid Cafe staring at a menu full of eggs and carbs. Ugh.  They didn't offer a Denver omelette so I decided to be adventurous and got the California omelette. I was shocked when I realized, that for an egg, it was pretty damned tasty.  As a matter of fact, I'd order it again. Except I didn't. I discovered this this Irish pub between Luxor and Mandalay Bay and lived there all week.  After all, everyone knows pubs are better than cafes.

N3oPGw0D4yxYAz4P0e5Sjg.text: Kinda reminded me of a diner. We were seated right away. The place wasn't very busy but it took a long time for our food to come. Their fruit plate was beautiful. Blackberries were HUGE!! The Cinnamon Roll French Toast was good; very filling. The service was pretty good too, other than the wait for the food to come.

photos.caption: Photo of Pyramid Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I think it&#39;s a side of fresh fruit (came on a regular-sized dinner plate).

4Hj9UHXc69GLInlMa3OuJw.text: Oh my! Rarely to I look up from my meal and say "I wish I'd just gotten a breakfast crunch wrap at Taco Bell!" Actually, I've never said that. Until now. My breakfast combo came with dried up disgusting sausage, POWDERED "eggs" and a tough and chewy pancake. How in the world do you make a pancake with a leathery texture? My suspicion is that these items were pulled off the buffet- it all tasted like it had been sitting out for a couple of hours. At least someone enjoyed it. The flies that joined us towards the end of the experience ate plenty. What's more, for an apple juice, two "specials" and a water the bill came to $40. There's too much good food in Vegas to waste a meal on garbage like this- even if you're in a hurry.

3Z8r9tCn9-5ZiKmTGQ1n4g.text: I've had worse breakfast food at actual breakfast establishments. I got the vegetarian omelette and it was super fluffy and filling. The Cinnabon French toast was also great. Sweet and soft.   Service was alright. Definitely doesn't deserve some of the two stars people were giving.

46-bxThKsyHRAE_-heZn2g.text: Worst experience ever. The manager and waitress were composing to each other in front of my whole group because we didn't want to sit in a tight booth. Our hostess said in Spanish " they insisted in moving" . Sooooo rude of them I speak Spanish. Watch what you say in public.   The food was too big of a portion so I didn't finish it. The hash browns oil and the pancakes dry.   The only good thing about this experience was an older gentleman bus boy who kept checking on us. He brought us refills, utensils when we dropped on and smiled so much it was contagious. He was the only assets to the cafe.

3BmEapE-Pbv0IBsWC85f7w.text: Decent coffee, decent oatmeal, decent hash browns. Nothing special, service wasn't great either.

SzBgjQKwThqJSSPuFSovbw.text: Yuck, food is so gross here. I guess you get what you pay for because Aria cafe is so much expensive but the food is so much better

tyOqX1vgVrcSaqUpHEZc8w.text: I was looking for a good place for breakfast. While staying in the Excalibur and reading about several bad reviews of the places there I choose the pyramid cafe as it was close and reviews seemed better.  Arriving at 11am on a Monday there was no line and the service quick and good. The New York steak and eggs breakfast for 17$ was very nice. Medium Steak cooked  perfectly. All fine.  Atmosphere also ok, no too loud (for Vegas).

QM2IF0wHWXJSHunvH2kwhg.text: I enjoyed the food. Good portions, made properly, no complaints there.   The BIG issue we had with this place was the service. The hostesses were nice, and accommodating since we requested a booth and they needed to have one cleaned for us. It was also extremely crowded, but that's to be expected to where we are. The tables aren't too close together, so it's not extremely distracting or anything with noise or people.   But our waitress was very frank and not attentive at all. She put in our orders and drinks then never came back. Empty glasses, empty plates, just completely ignored. She wasn't very friendly at all, no smile or anything, and seemed irritated when we asked for refills or more sauces.   Would probably not eat in here again, but I would order to go or room service. The food was very good.

0od2lwBRVL0lTL5DputNVg.text: The worst customer service at the Luxor Pyramid Cafe.  They would not take a phone order, The cafe person on the phone said come to the cafe and order. So I did like she said. The hostess said I have to sit at a table to make a to go order and let the waitress know. So I did and the waitress said she can't take my order, someone else will. So I sat there for 10 minutes, no one. I let the hostess know. She said they will take my order in a while, but no one showed up. If the pyramid cafe does not want to serve me because I was taking it to go, just say so I would went somewhere else. Instead the pyramid cafe wasted my morning  with no breakfast.  Will plan on staying elsewhere next time as the Luxor has poor food choices

i_BIWI6ZP4BUxVvpYR2_Gg.text: Hangover or. It, do not come here because the food were cold when it was serve to us.  Looks like This restaurant has problems in serving the food cold as I was reading the previous comments.

0QtRduOd9BW_ZuKY3sG_mQ.text: The food is pretty damn good, and the wait staff is very friendly. They also pop back in a lot to re-fill the coffee which is great in my book!  The first day I got the peanut butter french toast with bananas, the second I got the carrot cake french toast with cream cheese topping, and the last day  I got egg whites with veggies. The first two items were very rich, but excellent. I am glad I splurged. I also really enjoyed this place a lot more than the buffet in the Luxor.

aL8kWLVmahksCfbR8IiA9w.text: The food here is really decent. their eggs Benedict is awesome. The service is good  And the prices aren't to bad either. The only reason I give it four stars is because it closes to early. back in the day it use to be open 24/7 now the are only open for breakfast and lunch, and room service only serve until 2pm. Please open the cafe latter or serve room service 24/7 But do try its really good food.

pPVZ8R6drTgA6i9W0FdMVA.text: Solid 3 stars.  I came here for the breakfast because the prices were reasonable.  Staff was very nice and the food was good.  I had the cinnamon french toast.  I would not order that again but it was fine for the price.  The rest of the menu looked good too.  They also were very attentive on coffee and water.  I would go back, it is a good value.

Of2z0qTb3CmykYgXbEtjSg.text: I really wasn't in the mood for a buffet so I walked right past the one in the Excalibur on my way to see what Luxor had in the way of a coffee shop.  I wanted food cooked to order for me.  My food came out really fast.  I would be real surprised if any of it did not come from a warming tray.  The eggs were watery, the corned beef hash was dried out, I could only deal with part of the potatoes, the toast served wrapped in a basket was too cold even when it first got there to melt the butter.  The orange juice was really good and the decaf was ok.    The service was good and friendly.  The chairs were comfortable to lounge back in but not very comfortable to sit up to the table in.  Overall I was not really impressed paying $5 more plus tip for the same quality of food I could have gotten from the buffet.

AveSu-LN_zgHDe8v5yB4Bw.text: Convenience was what got this one 3 stars. The food was good, the prices were outrageous for anywhere else in the western hemisphere but down right cheap for Vegas, and it was convenient and open at all G*d awful hours that we were awake.

-T_DyAmCQvoglTmwcxk_ng.text: Stayed at the luxor and ate at this cafe three times the food was perfect way better than what you would expect and you have to try the monte cristo!

W94QU1zNy_qhU7IQFJhFTw.text: Food here was good, however the staff should be more informative.  A group of friends and I ate here this last weekend. My husband ordered three waffles, some hash browns and some bacon.  We didn't pay close attention to prices, we weren't concerned, until we got the bill..... each waffle cost $9.00 a piece. For his breakfast alone the price was $45+ ....the server should have stopped and said something to make him aware that he would be paying for each waffle separately.

IK6zp5kIqnrcuqU4CvLxlA.text: This is a decent place to eat late at night and the price was good for cafe.   I had the american breakfast with eggs, hash brown and ham.

EB048L_neK7FrHq1WwIhtA.text: The atmosphere isn't great.. but it's a 24 hour cafe, I wasn't expecting much. The wait staff was like being at a Denny's or Shari's... sweet older ladies [when we went at least]. I didn't see much that looked appealing, and split the Margherita pizza with my mother in law... AMAZING! who would have thought it!! Was perfect size to split, and then just added a side salad [the vinaigrette dressing was pretty disgusting however]. My husband had a burger and wasn't overly impressed. That pizza though... I'll tell ya, cheap.. decent size and the service was quick even though they were busy!!

qxHYH6SXfSg-lJ62-TPb1Q.text: Completely boring and bland. All Vegas breakfast joints should be able to serve up quality food to absorb/offset the inevitable hangovers. This place doesn't cut it.

MefaFrxPMAkvL66YMzeZhw.text: Open 24 hours.  Problem with it, you have to walk through the smoking to get to the non smoking area and it isn't separated very well.  Food is just ok, ok quantity and the staff seems tired and crankie and overworked.  Located on the first floor towards the pool.

d8sffPsyLfQbiwMUCm4P7A.text: My husband and I were pretty hungry when we got to the Luxor and we were pleasantly surprised that there were available tables in this Cafe Restaurant.  I had the BEST chicken pot pie I've ever eaten at a restaurant!!!  It was a simple, tasty pot pie with lots of chicken and vegetables and a light crust.   The service was excellent.

gH_ztPFpwwbfL6pLP_lyMg.text: After arriving to LV late night (9pm), most of the buffetts are already closed.  We just wanted someplace close to have a quick meal before getting some rest.  We should've walked further!  We've already knew we're in for a bad day when we were sat right at the entrance.  We asked for something inside (it was pretty quiet in the inside), but was told it's full.  We looked at the menu and all 6 guys ordered the prime rib ($19).  I figured, what the hell since I wasn't paying for it (one of the guys hit an $1800 jackpot before we arrived and buying dinner).  I order medium cook.  When the rib arrived, it was cooked completely through making the rib tough.  service was pretty slow, except when giving the bill (They were QUICK!)  Next time, I would rather eat Exalibur's Dogfood buffett than come here.  (Don't get me wrong, Exalibur's Dogfood buffett isn't cheap either.  It's running for $17!!!!.....probably McDonald would be the best option!

kmrkWGfEJ0PwC2UUdp1J4Q.text: I had a major issue with this place. Sure, it is Vegas and sure people get drunk, however it was 9:00 and hearing people yelling across the restaurant isn't a good thing. I asked for the manager and she gave us an attitude when I said that they need to do something about it. She said they aren't drunk (though the table was filled with empty bottles of beer and other alcohol containers. The menu is just ok and the prices are HIGH for what you get. The manager finally started getting more complaints about the obnoxious drunks and she comped us two drinks so that was cool, but I doubt I will go back here.

O1-HmDtsi4kOpHMo_PnONQ.text: I was going to write a lengthy review describing my experience at this restaurant, but I decided to spare us all. DON'T EAT HERE. GO TO THE BUFFET INSTEAD. You'll pay about the same amount of money and the service at the buffet is a million times better.

-A-PD_sLbePw0koEVn39Mg.text: We had breakfast here because it was free as a part of hotel credit we received for staying there.  The service was very fast.  The breakfast was the same quality as any local Denny's.  Although the food was typical, the service was excellent.

I91guQeKubq2xi8BykiYdg.text: My friends and I stayed at the Luxor. We were looking for a place to eat for breakfast, so we went to the Pyramid Cafe. I ordered a cheese omelette and hash brown which was to my surprise, good. During the course of our stay, we ate here two other times, twice for breakfast and once for a late night snack.  The food was very decent for the location and spot.  I would consider eating here again for breakfast.

-Sz_RMHhkarLLPDv6hoVSA.text: Good sandwiches & good food overall if you're staying at the Luxor.    Nothing fancy, but a good deal if you get the free $35 voucher at checkin.

b9_VVFrB-R8759JUsz1nBA.text: Pretty good, quick and fairly cheap by Vegas standards.  I can't really say anything bad about this place.  Lots of choices on the menu and tastes good too.  Far superior to places that purport to be classier and are located in higher end spots  (e.g., Red, White and Blue at Mandalay Bay).

EMJQFsPatllQD4WBsU2LSw.text: went for a late breakfast/brunch while we were staying at the luxor.  prices were reasonable, food was pretty good.  i had the corn beef hash and eggs, portion was good size, taste was good too.  a couple friends got pizzas which took a little longer to come, but still tasted good.  but the food seemed to be a really good meal to eat after drinking, gambling, and partying all night.  if you are down by luxor, i would recommend it for a place to stop by and try if you are hungry

BaSNafa_1iAKzBdsYV1kyw.text: I stayed at Luxor just for a girls weekend trip and of course we ended up at Pyramid Cafe after a long night out. The food was awful, I would rather have eaten a top ramen in my room. The pancakes were so tough and chewy and the bacon was bland...how does that happen??? If I ever stay at Luxor again, I'm bringing in snacks for late nights or going to the Denny's down the street.

f7frrYgu7d9WMzO-1NTJag.text: The food's not bad and the selection is great. The real convenience is that they're 24/7 and they serve breakfast all hours. Worth going to for a cheap meal in an otherwise expensive place.

5kMxo2upAMCVkG8rJmLa7A.text: Eat here only if you don't feel like driving or don't care about quality and price.  Breakfast was about 15 per person. Glass of small orange juice was about $350 as well as a cup of coffee. Hash browns looked lifeless like the ones in the grocery freezer. Hand made corned beef hash was dead also and hardly crispy. Waiter made a lot of mistakes with the order and preoccupied for some reason. This place should be torn down and started over along with everything else in the casino area. Sort of like everything is embalmed here.

VUsnlVtK9pgSW-e5ejt9kA.text: I found the Monte Cristo at the Pyramid Cafe in Luxor for $11.95 on 4/15/11. I try these sandwiches whenever I see one so I have tasted many in my day. A lot of reviews had said to try another place in Vegas, but this place was convenient. Unfortunately, the sandwhich wasn't great. It's not open-faced; it's completely enclosed between two very thich slices of french bread, so you're basically eating 4 slices of thick french toast with a layer of mozerella and ham inside each slice. There was very minimal powered sugar on each slice and the jam - strawberry - had chunks of strawberry in it and was more like a juice than a preserve. I wasn't impressed. The service was average and ht wait staff was just so-so. I'd go here for a quick snack or lunch but not for a nice evening out.
